Whiskeyã§ã™ã‹
82 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
86 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
1.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 juin 2017
Nephise Begins is the prequel to a game called, oddly enough, Nephise (that's pronounced "Neh-fee-see", by the way, and is the name of the young female protagonist in both games). For those who haven't yet played the original, I wouldn't worry: they're very similar and there's little to no plot or character to speak of, so it's much of a muchness which order you play them in.

That said, I must confess to having enjoyed this one slightly more, perhaps because the first one felt a bit circular in its mapping - you basically just walk around a circular path, as well as exploring a small area in the middle - while the mapping in this one is a bit more expansive and requires a mite more exploration to find all its nooks and crannies. Sure, the puzzles are slightly fewer and even easier than those in the first installment, but if you're buying games like this for the puzzles, you really do need to reassess your purchasing habits.

It's short (under an hour, with all Achievements), beautiful to look at, has lovely music, and is genuinely relaxing provided you're in the right mindset. And, well, whad'ya know...it's also cheap as chips. Oh, and in spite of not being a "horror" game per se, it does have a very creepy bit right at the end (which I won't spoil with further details)!

When all is said and done, it's little more than a brief indulgence for your sense of wonder, but isn't that something worth indulging from time to time? Not every game needs to be as long as Skyrim, as hard as Dark Souls, or as "deep" as Dear Esther. If you're the kind of person who, like myself, desires something short and soothing upon occasion, you won't find much to complain about here. And if you're still set on being stingy about the price, I'm sure you'll find it on sale often enough. Done deal.

Verdict: 7/10.
 
rjmacready

Ğ¤Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ ÑĞºÑ€Ğ¸Ğ¿ĞºÑƒ Ñ Ğ»ĞµĞ³ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¿ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ĞµĞ¼ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ»Ğ°ÑĞºĞ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑĞ»ÑƒÑ…, Ğ° Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒĞ¼Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´ Ğ½ĞµĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµÑĞ° Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒĞ·Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ² ÑÑ‚Ñƒ Ğ½ĞµÑĞ¿ĞµÑˆĞµÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ĞºÑƒ. Ğ”Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ„ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ.

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞµĞ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ÑĞµĞ¼ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ±ÑƒĞºĞ²Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ½ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ‹ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞº. Ğ˜Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ¸Ğµ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ°, Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞ²Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ½Ğ° Ğ³Ğ¾Ñ€ÑˆĞºĞ¸. Ğ—Ğ²ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ, Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠÑÑĞ½ÑĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ğ´Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ¼ (Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½ÑĞ» Ğ²Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ñƒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑÑƒÑ‚ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ ÑÑƒĞ±Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²), Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²Ğ»ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ. ĞŸĞ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ°Ğ¶ Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚, ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ñ€ĞµĞ·ĞºĞ¾ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ° Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°ĞµÑˆÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğ°ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğµ Ñ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‚Ğ¸ÑˆĞ¸Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹. ĞœĞ½Ğµ Ğ°Ğ¶ ĞºĞ°Ğ¿ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞºÑƒ Ğ¶ÑƒÑ‚ĞºĞ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾. Ğ›Ğ¸Ñ-Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‚ Ğ¸ÑÑ‡ĞµĞ·Ğ°ĞµÑ‚, Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´ÑƒĞµĞ¼ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ² Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ â€” ĞºĞ°ĞºÑƒÑ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ‰ĞµÑ€Ñƒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½ÑƒÑ, Ğ° Ğ²ÑÑ‘ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ¾ĞºÑƒÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¿Ğ»Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸. Ğ Ğ² ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ğµ, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ´Ñ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ‰ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‰ĞµĞµ Ñ†ĞµÑ€ĞºĞ¾Ğ²ÑŒ, Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‘Ğ¼ ĞºĞ°ĞºÑƒÑ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ñ‘Ğ¼Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ñ…Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµÑ€Ñƒ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ½ĞµĞ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ€ĞµÑˆĞ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğµ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ (Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ÑĞ¾Ğ»ÑŒ Kill Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑĞ°Ğ»Ğ°).

Ğ˜Ğ· Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑĞ¾Ğ²: Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ñ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ (Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿ÑƒĞºÑ‚ĞµÑ€ Ğ¾Ñ‰ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°Ğ» Ğ³Ñ€ĞµÑ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ½Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ĞºĞ°Ñ…), Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ñ€ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµÑƒĞ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‚ĞµĞºÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ€ĞºĞµ (Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ñƒ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾, Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»ÑÑ, Ğ° Ğ² Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ğ³, ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ» Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ²ĞºĞ¸).

Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ñƒ? ĞÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµĞ½ĞºÑƒ Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ñƒ, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾, Ğ±Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ½ĞµĞ³Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ñ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ». ĞĞ½Ğ¸, ÑĞºĞ¾Ñ€ĞµĞµ, Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµĞ¹Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ â€” Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ»Ñ‘Ğ³ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ ÑƒĞºĞ»Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ² Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‚ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾. ĞŸĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ:

Ğ¯ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ²ĞµÑ€ÑˆĞ¸Ğ» Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒĞ¼Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ²ĞµÑÑŒĞ¼Ğ° ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ½ÑƒÑ Nephise Begins, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ½ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµĞ½ĞºÑƒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¶Ğµ ĞµĞµ Ğ²Ğ·ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ ÑƒÑ‰ĞµÑ€Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°. Ğ¡Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»Ñ ÑĞ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ»ĞµÑ†, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´ÑƒĞºÑ‚Ğ°, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ²ĞµÑĞ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ´ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Nephise Begins.
ĞĞ°Ñ‡Ğ½ĞµĞ¼ Ñ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸Ğ· ÑĞµĞ±Ñ ÑĞ¸Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑŒĞ±Ñ‹. Ğ—Ğ²ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ²Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ»ĞµÑÑƒ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ÑĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ²Ğ·Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºÑ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ñ‰Ğ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ»ĞµÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¹ ÑĞ¾Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ½Ñ‡Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ğ¼Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğµ ÑƒÑˆĞ¸. Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€ÑƒĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼ĞµĞ´Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ·ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ»Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ğ»ĞµÑĞ°, Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ€ÑĞ´ Ğ»ĞµĞ³ĞºĞ¸Ñ… Ğ·Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº, ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ĞºĞ¸ *ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ†Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ* Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ñ‹, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºÑ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºÑƒ Ğ½ĞµĞ·Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ‹ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹, Ğ´Ğ° Ğ¸ Ğ² Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´ ÑĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¼. Ğ¡ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¶Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»ĞºĞ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ²ĞµÑ‰Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸. Ğ¢ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¸ ÑˆĞ°Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ ÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ñ‹Ğµ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿ÑŒÑÑ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¶Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹, Ğ´Ğ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¸ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ³ÑƒĞ»ĞºĞ¸, Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ°Ñ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ²Ğ¿ÑƒÑĞºĞ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ°ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ Ğ² ÑĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑĞ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹, Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ»ÑĞ±Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ²Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğº Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠÑÑĞ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ ÑĞ¸Ñ‚ÑƒĞ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸. Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğº Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»ĞµĞ½ÑŒĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ¾Ğº ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·ĞºĞ¸, Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆÑƒÑ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ¹. Ğ£ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ²Ğ½ÑƒÑˆĞ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ¿Ğ¸ÑĞ¾Ğº Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ², Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑÑ‹ Ğ¸Ğ´ÑƒÑ‚ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ¼, Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğ·Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Nephise Begins Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ-Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ÑŒ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ²Ğ°Ñ. Ğ ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ğ», Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ, Ğ³Ğ¾ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°, Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ° Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑˆĞ½ĞµĞµ ÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑĞ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞµ Ğ²Ğ¿ĞµÑ‡Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ. ĞĞµĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Nephise Begins Ğ¸ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹, Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¶Ğµ Ñ‡ÑƒÑ‚ĞºĞ° Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²ÑĞµĞ´Ğ½ĞµĞ²Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… Ğ·Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¸ ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ²ĞºĞµ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·ĞºĞ¸. Ğ¥Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñƒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ²ÑĞµÑ… Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ñƒ Ğ¸ Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¹ĞºĞ¸, Ğ±ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ³Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ½ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ±ĞµĞ³Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ ÑˆĞ»Ğ°ĞºĞ° Ğ² Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ½Ğµ.

âœ” âœ” âœ” âœ˜ âœ˜ âœ˜ âœ˜ âœ˜ âœ˜ âœ˜
3 / 10

I'm sorry but no, not either.

If you have already played Nephise, you will quickly get to know your way around because, except for a few changes, the games are similar in terms of both structure and location.

With the big difference that this is even worse than Nephise.

In this game, Location is a forest again, but with more sun and fog and no snow like in Nephise. There are a few more rocky hills here. Lots more rocky hills to climb.

Basically, the atmosphere conveyed in the forest is well implemented and, as in every TonguÃ§ Bodur game, there are always â€œeye-catchersâ€ that convey a great atmosphere, but I think that that is simply not enough. Even if the games are really cheap and distract you for a few minutes with a walk in the woods, that's just not enough. Not to say it was nice...

The area isn't really that big, but since it's set in a mountainous forest area, there are lots of paths leading up. For this reason you can hop again instead of running faster. The fact of hopping and the mountain paths turned the game from a walking simulator to a hopping simulator within a very short time. In the end, I more or less just hopped through the entire game.
Well, admittedly, the constant jumping is certainly a â€œbad habitâ€ that comes from other games, but still...

In the game there are optional mushrooms to collect that are necessary for an achievement. There are also 4 skulls added for â€œstory progressionâ€. In principle, these collecting tasks also ensure that you will see almost everything in the area. You have to place the collected skulls on 2 tall amphoras and when you turn them the right way up, a secret path opens again, which is guarded by a fox until then, which then gets up and goes away... However, this is not a real challenge.

Well, it's not like the fox is running. Although he makes strange movements in the air, he sets off more like a reindeer and floats away. I don't know if this is some kind of bug and if it was just me, or if it's supposed to be something mystical. I definitely found it more than just strange and I also think the animal is just way too big in relation to everything else. But well, maybe the â€œmysticalâ€ comes into play. No idea.

Even though there are a few places in the game that are definitely worth seeing and worth a screenshot, if you look closer and in some places you will notice that there are a lot of graphical errors, muddy textures and a lot of reloading.
Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : ğğŒğğŸğ‚ğ‘ğğ

I think it's a bit of a shame somewhere because the surroundings simply make up the whole thing here. But unfortunately it is often the case with TonguÃ§ Bodur games that the quality fluctuates greatly. Same here.

The â€œstoryâ€ is told again by a narrator. As always, very taciturn and basically only speaks up when you have to do or see something. I'm keeping quiet about the ending because it's just as terrible as the ending of Nephise, but it tops the whole thing.
The creature that appears is truly ugly and grotesque. But not because of the creature itself, but because it's just poorly made and doesn't look good.
The end is like standing in front of the ice cream parlor window all day and when you're finally let in, all you get is a walnut. Disappointing.

I wouldn't necessarily call the game a complete failure because the price (especially on sale) is quite reasonable.

If you take into account the fact that the game and the achievements are included in the statistics and there are trading cards, then you can definitely take a look at the game.

Visually, the game is quite attractive, but if you want a good story, puzzle challenges or more discovery, you can really save yourself the trouble of playing.

Review date: December 21, 2023

PLAYED WITH: âŒ¨ï¸ ğŸ–± ğŸ§

â®© VISIT ME IN MY LITTLE WORLD

3 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

Non recommandÃ©
1.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 fÃ©vrier 2018
Nephise Begins is a very detailed walking simulator.
You don't do much more than walking, collecting a few items, relaxing and exploring the unknown.

While walking the Nephise Begins, you will be accompanied by a friendly female voice that guides you.
You will see stunning sights along the way, That are perfect for making beautiful screenshots.
The sounds of nature were so fitting to the scenery and it was perfectly done.
The game made me feel like I was part of a fairy tale.
My personal favorite was definitely the huge keeper guardian fox.

There were a few puzzle's that you had to complete in order to finish the game, but they are easily completed.
The game didn't have an engaging story, and the ending felt abrupt.
You can complete the entire game within 15 minutes!
It's way too short, and for that reason I can't recommend it.

Nephise Begins - Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ´Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ»ĞºĞ° Ğ¾Ñ‚ TonguÃ§ Bodur, Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ ĞºĞ°Ğº ĞĞµÑ„Ğ¸ÑĞµ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ° ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑˆĞ°Ñ€Ñ‹.

Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸Ğ¹, Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ Ğ»ĞµĞ³Ñ‡Ğµ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. ĞÑ‚ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. ĞĞ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ· Ğ½Ğ° Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñƒ ÑˆĞ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑÑ‚ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ‹, Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ 10 Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ², Ğ·Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ. Ğ’ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ‰ĞµÑ€Ñƒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ , ĞµĞµ Ğ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½ÑĞµÑ‚ Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ, Ğ¸ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğº, Ğ° Ğ»Ğ¸ÑĞ°. Ğ§Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ° Ğ’Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑƒÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ°, Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ 4 Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ„Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹. Ğ”Ğ»Ñ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°ĞµÑ‚Ğµ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ? ĞÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ĞºÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ„Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ² Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ, Ğ² Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºÑ€ÑƒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¸. Ğ˜ Ğ»Ğ¸ÑĞ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñƒ ÑƒĞ»ĞµÑ‚Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ±Ğ¾. Ğ“Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ½ĞµÑ‚, ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ° Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠÑÑĞ½ÑĞµÑ‚ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ. Ğ‘Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¸Ğ½ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµÑÑƒ Ğ² Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸ÑĞºĞ°Ñ… Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ². Ğ’ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ†Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¾Ğ¿ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ²ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµÑ‡Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑÑƒÑ‰ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾ÑĞ½ÑƒĞ²ÑˆĞ¸ÑÑŒ Ğº Ğ½ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ, Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ¼Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°ĞµÑ‚.

Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ·Ğ° 40 Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚, Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ±Ñ‹ÑÑ‚Ñ€ĞµĞµ.

Ğ“Ñ€Ğ°Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ° Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¶Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ñ‹Ğ´ÑƒÑ‰ĞµĞ¹ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸, Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ñ€ĞµĞ·ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¸ ÑÑ€ĞºĞ°Ñ, Ğ¸ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğµ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¼Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¾.

Ğ•ÑÑ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ»Ğ»ĞµĞºÑ†Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ĞºĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¸ 5 Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¶ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹. Ğ¢Ğ°Ğº Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑƒÑ‚ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒÑÑ‚ Ñ€ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğµ ÑÑƒĞ±Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‚Ñ€Ñ‹.

Ğ’ Ğ¾Ğ±Ñ‰ĞµĞ¼ Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºÑƒÑ Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ñƒ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸, Ñ‚ÑƒÑ‚ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾, Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞµ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñƒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´ÑƒĞºÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½ĞµĞµ, Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ ÑˆÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ 40 Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñƒ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ´Ñ€ÑƒĞ³Ğ¾Ğ¹.

ĞĞ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€ ÑĞ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¼Ğ¾ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ, ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ñ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ÑĞ¾Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°ÑĞ½Ñ‹, Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ… Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑˆĞ¸Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ°Ğ´ĞµĞºĞ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾. Ğ£ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ!

RecommandÃ©
4.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 avril 2017
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Explore. Collect. Enjoy. Relax. These are the essence of Nephise Begins.

Exploration - The game is a short (30 mins - 1h) walking simulator with a few puzzle elements sprinkled here and there. The entire gameplay consists of exploring the world around you and discovering the story behind it. Just like in Nephise, the exploration area consists of a forest, with a small and cozy house in the center and a mysterious animal guardian. This time, a spring sun bathes the whole valley in a warm sunlight and the hills surrounding the forest can now be explored too.

Collectibles - 10 optional collectibles and 4 mandatory ones (needed for story progression) await to be found. They come naturally as you explore the surrounding region and most of them are not very hard to find, a discrete red glowing indicating their hiding places in the shadow of the trees.

Enjoy the sights - the scenery is astonishing, as in all other creations of the developer, with amazing lighting and beautiful graphic detail.

Relax - The narrator's voice is very soothing and its peculiar accent is very charming. This, combined with a beautiful soundtrack with female vocals will surely help you relax.

More reviews on the Lilly's Corner Curator page

ã¾ã åˆã‚ã¦é–“ã‚‚ãªã„ã®ã§ã™ãŒã€ã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨æ°—ã«ãªã£ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã ã‘ã€‚åé›†ã€æ¢ç´¢ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ãªã®ã§ã™ãŒã€ã“ã®ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã«ã¯ã‚»ãƒ¼ãƒ–æ©Ÿèƒ½ãŒãªã„ã§ã™ã€‚ã‚ã¨ã€ãƒ€ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ã‚‚ãªãã€æ´çªŸã«å…¥ã£ãŸå¾Œã‹ã‚‰æ­©ãé€Ÿåº¦ãŒé…ããªã‚Šã¾ã™ã®ã§ã€è‹›ã€…ã™ã‚‹æ–¹ã‚‚ã„ã‚‰ã£ã—ã‚ƒã‚‹ã‹ã‚‚ã§ã™ã€‚ï¼ˆé›°å›²æ°—ã‚’ã ã™ãŸã‚ã«ãã†ã—ã¦ã‚‹ã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã‹ï¼Ÿï¼Ÿï¼‰ã™ãçµ‚ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã‹ãªï¼Ÿã¨æ€ã£ãŸã‚‰æ„å¤–ã«ãã†ã§ã‚‚ãªã•ãã†ãªã®ã§ã€ååˆ†æ™‚é–“ãŒã¨ã‚Œã‚‹ã¨ãã«ãƒ—ãƒ¬ã‚¤ã—ãŸã»ã†ãŒã„ã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ï¼ˆå®Ÿç¸¾ã®ã‚­ãƒã‚³é›†ã‚ã¨ã‹ã‚’æ°—ã«ã›ãšã€ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ¼ã ã‘ãªã‚‰æ—©ãçµ‚ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ï¼‰
ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒªãƒ¼å†…å®¹ã¯â€¦å€¤æ®µãŒå€¤æ®µãªã®ã§çŸ­ã„ã§ã™

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

RecommandÃ©
1.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 mars 2021
Nephise Begins is a visually stunning walking sim set entirely in a gorgeous forest.

Being a basic walking sim Nephise Begins doesn't have a real plot. That's cool because what it does have is a friendly voice. Inside my head. That tells me what to do. She reminds me of a grandmotherly figure. Soft and soothing.

I'm tasked with collecting a total of ten mushrooms; no more, no less. Why? I really don't know. Maybe people just wanted to get me out of the house for a bit. Maybe they are for lunch later. Maybe, they are "medicinal". That last one makes the most sense to me, especially with granny in my head. Trust me, when you start finding and picking up random animal skulls or seeing a giant fox, you'll agree that something strange is going on here too!!

Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Emlin

Seriously though, this is such a pretty little game. Although you are all but trapped in a forest, it's a very relaxing experience. Well, minus trying to find that tenth mushroom. Throwback to my time playing Kingdom Hearts all those years ago, where I spent a good 40 minutes looking for that third and final mushroom in the starting area. I totally ended up looking at a walkthrough... This time, however, I did not seek outside help, and felt very rewarded upon finally hunting that elusive bad boy down!

Nephise Begins uses the direction of the light to create a great mix of shadow and sun. The sun has a warm yellow hue, which certainly adds to the calm of the game. The shading helps add detail and texture to the trees and rocks. Overall, the attention to detail was very nice.

Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Emlin

The soundtrack in this game was picked perfectly to add to the easy-going vibe. One of those songs made me think of a scene from the movie 'Edward Scissorhands' (hello fellow Tim Burton fans); specifically, the Christmas scene, where Edward is sculpting the ice, and that blond chick decides to start dancing. I'm not sure why though, they aren't exactly identical. Clearly, it activated a certain part of my brain.

Along with the soundtrack, the ambience was charming. I especially loved the sounds of the birds. Very sweet!

As I mentioned earlier, granny wanted to be the voice inside my head. Her voice acting was delightful. The quality was good and she was clean and crisp. She didn't want to talk to me too much, but what she did have to say was either helpful or somewhat strange. I wondered how she knew some of these things. However, I listened, followed her instructions and ended up murdering an innocent harpy that just wanted to live in a pretty cool looking place, inside a mushroom cave. I wish I found this cave earlier. Would have saved me all that walking. I then went hunting for magical orbs of power.

Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Emlin

I still don't know why I felt compelled to hunt down ten mushrooms in the forest, to begin with. Alas, the mysteries of life I suppose.

Although Nephise Begins is only a short game that took me just over an hour to finish, it has no save system. It states as much before the game starts. It's not really a problem if you have the free time, but I thought it was worth mentioning anyway.

Overall, it was a nice, calming little experience. It did a great job at sparking my imagination. I think I came up with a dozen or so mini-stories of how and why I found myself in this situation; each more ridiculous than the last. I very much appreciated the creative spark!
 
Emlin
481 produits enregistrÃ©s
6
46 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 octobre 2017
Another day, another asset flip. That seems to be my life lately. Today's installment is another Tonguc Bodur gem, Nephise Begins. This prequel to the complete non-entity that is Nephise is basically the same game with a few slight improvements.

You play as a young but fragile girl named Nephise who can jump off of sheer cliffs stories high and needs exactly ten mushrooms. While mushroom hunting, she finds some skulls and uses them to persuade a fox to let her enter a cave, where she learns that she'd rather be an orb collector.

Things you do in this game include: walking into a house, pick up mushrooms, pick up animal skulls for no stated reason, turn vases around, kill a harpy through your leprous touch, walk through a cave, wake up a fox, and collect one orb. That's it. So that's not much to do in a game.

The pros of this game are that you move at a relatively normal speed (which you don't in the first game), you don't have to do any puzzles that lie to you (which, again, the dev had trouble with last time), there are a couple of fun-ish missable achievements, and the stock music was better this time.

The â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ are that everything in this game is stock except the narration, which merely leaves no impression at all on you. I was meditating on these games a bit, and it occurred to me that one of my main complaints with the series is that the storytelling (and "progression") is all delivered via narration. A piece of advice for Mr. Bodur: show, don't tell. Particularly in video games, one of the most interesting ways to deliver information is organically, through in-game experiences. On the other hand, these games suck all the fun out of the point of being a game by telling you exactly what to do in words and not giving you really any information that YOU can glean from the audio and visuals.

One of the reasons this sucks so much is that this tell-don't-show method ruins even the slightest amount of immersion you might otherwise have had, since Nephise the character, dwelling in a world with no narrator, would have no reason to solve the game's two puzzles or do anything besides collect mushrooms and go home.

A side note: despite what the Store page says, there's no fog in this game. It doesn't really matter, but it is a lie.

One of the most damning criticisms a game can get is the ratio of playtime to achievements unlocked. Take me, for instance. I have no need to play this game ever again, and I got 100% of the achievements in about 40 minutes. And that was with a lot of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ around, like futilely trying to find a lose state or climb the ladder in the game. If that doesn't tell you that this game isn't worth your money, I don't know what will. Yes, the Unreal engine is pretty. The stock assets used here are pretty. The lighting effects are pretty. The stock music is soothing. But there's nothing of value here. Play a game where someone made original textures or music in the Unreal engine. Play a game where someone implemented controls outside of the most basic FPE settings. Play a game where something happens, or you do something that sounds like it might matter. Do people even make games like that anymore?


What have we done?
 
Salmon Jones The Magnificent
0

2ã€åœ°å›¾æ¢ç´¢æ–¹é¢ã€‚æœ¬æ¸¸æˆåœ°å›¾å¤§ä¸”é‡å¤ï¼Œæœ‰ç‰©ç†å¼•æ“ã€‚æœ¬äººå»ºè®®å…ˆä»åœ°å›¾è¾¹ç¼˜æ‰¾ä¸€åœˆå¼€å§‹æ”¶é›†ï¼Œå› ä¸ºæœ‰äº›åœ°å½¢å¯ä»¥çˆ¬å±±ï¼Œå±±ä¸Šæœ‰è˜‘è‡å’Œå¤´éª¨ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘å…ˆå»ºè®®ç¡®å®šäº†è¾¹ç¼˜åœ¨ç¼©å°æœé›†èŒƒå›´ã€‚
3ã€è§£è°œæ–¹é¢ã€‚æœ¬æ¸¸æˆä¸€å…±è®¾ç½®äº†2ä¸ªè§£è°œè¦ç´ ï¼š1ã€æ”¶é›†äº†4ä¸ªåŠ¨ç‰©å¤´éª¨åçš„æ—‹è½¬ç½å­ï¼›2ã€å±±æ´ä¸­çš„æœºå…³é—¨ã€‚å…¶ä¸­â‘ å»ºè®®ç”¨ç©·ä¸¾æ³•ï¼ˆåŠ¨ç‰©å¤´éª¨å…¨æ”¾ä¸Šç½å­åä»¥æŸä¸€ä¸ªç½å­çš„æŸä¸ªæ–¹å‘ä¸ºå‡†ï¼Œæ—‹è½¬å¦å¤–ä¸€ä¸ªç½å­ï¼Œç›´åˆ°æˆåŠŸä¸ºæ­¢ï¼‰ï¼›â‘¡çš„è§£è°œå¾ˆå®¹æ˜“ï¼Œè¸©å‡¸èµ·çš„æœºå…³è€Œå·²ã€‚

ANÃLISIS DE "NEPHISE BEGINS":

Walking simulator muy simple, no tardarÃ¡s ni 20 minutos en terminarlo. El objetivo es encontrar 10 setas en el escenario, mientras se nos cuenta una sencilla historia carente de sentido y completamente en inglÃ©s, tanto voces como textos, ademÃ¡s de 4 calaveras de animales. El juego tiene un par de puzzles de lo mÃ¡s simple y nada mÃ¡s. Lo Ãºnico que merece la pena es para relajarse un rato y darse un paseo por los bellos escenarios.

Tuvieron un gran detalle al regalarlo durante el confinamiento por coronavirus, pero ni siquiera estando gratis podrÃ­a recomendarlo, puesto que el juego tiene varios bugs importantes: Es fÃ¡cil quedarse atascado entre los Ã¡rboles, teniendo que reiniciar la partida desde el principio puesto que no se puede guardar, lo cual me parece un error mÃ¡s que suficiente para darle valoraciÃ³n negativa.

AdemÃ¡s hay fallos en los logros ya que no saltan en ocasiones cuando deberÃ­an hacerlo aunque los hayas conseguido realmente.

A continuaciÃ³n mi lista de pros y contras:

PROS:

- Lo han regalado durante el confinamiento por el Coronavirus

- Visualmente es muy bonito

- La mÃºsica es relajante

CONTRAS:

- No se puede guardar la partida, lo cual es realmente tedioso dado lo fÃ¡cil que es quedarse atascado entre los Ã¡rboles y obligÃ¡ndonos a empezar de nuevo la partida

- El juego estÃ¡ completamente en inglÃ©s

- Es muuuy corto

- La historia carece de sentido alguno

- Se hace muy aburrido

- No hay interacciÃ³n â™¥â™¥â™¥ el entorno

- Los puzzles son muy simples y escasos

- Los logros dan problemas en muchas ocasiones

ConclusiÃ³n:

Ni siquiera estando gratis puedo darle valoraciÃ³n positiva, una pena. Igualmente se agradece el detalle de haberlo regalado durante el confinamiento por covid.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 juin 2017
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Introduction
Just as its name suggests, Nephise Begins is a prequel to Nephise. As of this writing, both are TonguÃ§ Bodur latest creations and they are the developerâ€™s attempt towards a new direction. Obviously, this separates the Nephise series from the Drizzleplath one, yet even if I didnâ€™t know who developed these last few titles, just by looking at them for a few minutes, I would have pointed out towards TonguÃ§. He really knows how to pick these abstract ideas and turn them into something beautiful. Still, dreams can quickly turn to nightmares and the abstract subgenre in the case of walking simulators, always features a double-sided coin.

Story
The titular character is a young female which doesnâ€™t share any of her thoughts or give voice to her concerns. Players shall have to find details from her life, through the help of a female narrator which speaks on Nephiseâ€™s behalf. The journey begins in the middle of a relatively vast forest and the main objective is to get past the Forest Guardian. A giant fox, because we needed to be reminded of the abstract nature of this title. Nephise shall have to find the four animal skulls scattered across the woodland and also pick up ten red mushrooms, as a secondary objective which doesnâ€™t alter the storyline in any manner at all. Pretty straightforward and there arenâ€™t many hidden meanings or symbols behind this quest and journey.

Graphics
Powered by Unreal Engine 4, Nephise Begins forced me run it in 2K, since stability at 4K resolution would result in less than 30 frames per second. Screenshots look great, regardless. It may be a brief forest exploration, yet I still found enough screenshot opportunities and Iâ€™m certain that part of this gameâ€™s charm comes from relaxing and taking in the sights. There are no situations which might endanger you, so why hurry? It goes without saying, that youâ€™ll be able to accomplish your objectives if you are patient enough and keep your eyes peeled.

Audio
Repetitve tune or not, I enjoyed the soundtrack and the narrator was a pleasant touch as well, even if I would have preferred to hear the heroine herself and her own perspective into the trip and mysterious encounters. No reason to complain, though. Itâ€™s a walking simulator, not an audiobook.

Gameplay
I think I already cleared the key aspects of the gameplay in the Story section above. Donâ€™t expect me to spoil even the few elements of the game I havenâ€™t discussed yet. It is indeed rather short, you should be able to see it though in less than two hours, perhaps just one if you donâ€™t care about the Achievements for finding the mushrooms and hidden N symbol. But if you really lack the patience for peaceful exploration, than I really donâ€™t think that this might be the genre youâ€™d enjoy playing anyways.

Thereâ€™s no action, you donâ€™t fight anything, not even for your survival. Had my fair share of â€œsurvival in the woodsâ€ indie games and Iâ€™m glad Nephise Begins isnâ€™t instructing me to collect twigs for a campfire, only to get mauled to death by a wolf pack. You just explore the surroundings, at your own pace and on a fairly large map. Visual cues in the form of small floating orbs, shall make the discovery of the mushrooms or skulls, much easier than it might seem at first glance. There are some structures to visit as well, but for the majority of the gameplay, youâ€™ll be heading outdoors.

Verdict
The shortest of the Bondur creations to date, Nephise Begins still packs the beauty and symbolism worthy for any self-respecting walking simulator. It certainly wonâ€™t bother fans of the genre and perhaps even new players might find the brief gameplay, to be an excellent introduction to more complex, future forays into this particular type of video games which have no expectations from their playerbase other than to relax while taking a hike across a peaceful environment. Rest assured, you get your moneyâ€™s worth from this title.

Strong Points
+ Abstract experience.
+ Gorgeous graphics and sounds.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.

Weak Points
- Brief and with no replay value.
- Abstract experience.

Rating 70/100

This review was submitted for Imperial Reviews and Cubbes.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 aout 2023
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

My Playtime: 21m (100% achievement, finished the game)
Grindy Achievement(s): No.
Optional Achievement(s): Yes (3 achievements).
Difficult Achievement(s): No.

Intro
Nephise Begins is a walking simulator game where you collect mushrooms and do whatever the narrator told you. It's a short game that will take less than 1 hour to finish.

Pros:
- Relaxing music

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- Very slow walking speed, especially once you are in the cave
- No save option

Specs
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

Should you buy this game?
No.
Unless you like walking sims and don't mind the short length, I don't see why you should buy it.


In-Depth Review

Visuals
Nephise Begins looks like other realistic 3D games with a forest-themed environment. The only exception is that the lighting makes the game looks atmospheric to some extent, although, in some places, it can blind you and make it hard to see your surroundings without moving the camera in other directions.

Story
The story doesn't make sense. It starts by telling you to collect some mushrooms, but then the game never specifies the why and the conclusion of that mushroom collecting. Nephise, the main character, feels like exploring a completely new area for her and doing other ridiculous stuff that the narrator told her. Moreover, the introduction of other animals and how they "leave the screen" just doesn't make sense at all.

The Game
Gameplay
Nephise Begins presents you with a vast forest area to explore, where you can collect optional mushrooms and skulls that are mandatory to advance the story. The location of the mushrooms will be noticeable by the red aura it emits, while the skulls are going to show on the map once you are located close to it. To be honest, I had an issue finding the skulls and some mushrooms when I played it for the first time, mainly because I missed some hills that I was supposed to climb.

Despite the vast area, it can be hard to see where you can and you can't go. Both edges of the forest house some cliffs that might require you to go the other way to explore. Sometimes, this might not be noticeable to some people, making them think that they have reached the edge of the map.

Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : MeowRawrHehe


Sadly, there is no save at all. The game states it at the beginning, and although the game is very short, I still find it better to have a save option. I tried to finish this game before sleeping, and once I figured out that I couldn't finish it that day, I decided to give it another try tomorrow, but I had to start everything from scratch again.

The game has a very slow walking speed. Moreover, there is no dash option either. I don't mind having to explore the vast area, but the slow walking speed just doesn't sit right with me. It feels as if the game was padded out for its playtime, especially since it becomes slower once you reached a cave.

á´›Êœá´‡ Ò“á´Ê€É¢á´á´›á´›á´‡É´ Ò“á´Ê€á´‡sá´› 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Hanford


Length and Difficulty
I finished the game in 21 minutes. I already played the game for around 30 minutes the day before, where I closed the game since I couldn't find some items that are needed to advance the story. The game isn't hard as long as you manage to find everything. Moreover, there are always some guides that can help you if you are stuck.

Conclusion
I didn't enjoy playing Nephise Begins. The story doesn't interest me, and as a walking simulator game, I didn't find any areas that captivate me. The dealbreaker was the slow walking speed. I know that the game is very cheap, but it's also very short and I just couldn't seem to recommend it except for its relaxing music.

Nephise Begins
Walking Symulator von 2017
1.250tes Spiel mit Bewertung in meinem Shop.

Nephise Begins erzÃ¤hlt dem Spieler, was zu der Zeit passierte, bevor Nephise ein Sammler der Lichte wurde. Der Haupt-Schauplatz ist wieder Wald, diesmal aber ohne Schnee, dafÃ¼r eher sonniges und diesiges Wetter. Und man kann mehr HÃ¼gel erklettern.
Es ist ein kurzes und atmosphÃ¤risches RÃ¤tselspiel mit ErzÃ¤hlung.

Nun ja RÃ¤tselspiel ist wohl doch ein wenig Ã¼bertrieben. 4 SchÃ¤del Suchen, 2 links- 2 rechts auf eurem Weg zu eurem Ziel, wo ihr diese auf 2 Ampfohren ablegt und sie dann ein wenig drehen mÃ¼ÃŸt, wo bei euer Ziel, ein HÃ¶hleneingang, nur ein paar hundet Meter, gerade aus liegt?

Mein Text zusammen mit den Bildern der Werbung und ihr kennt fast das ganze Spiel. Ihr kÃ¶nnt Pilze sammeln unterwegs, oder ihr kÃ¶nnt es auch lassen.
Eine entspannende Umgebung erwartet euch, die durchaus gut gemacht ist, mehr aber auch nicht.
Ich wÃ¼ste keinen Grund warum ihr es Spielen solltet, aber das ist ja eure Entscheidung. Da es nichts zu mekern gibt, Daumen rauf.

Nephise Begins
Walking Symulator from 2017
1,250th game with evaluation in my shop.

Nephise Begins tells the player what happened around the time before Nephise became a collector of the lights. The main scene is again forest, but this time without snow, but rather sunny and hazy weather. And you can climb more hills.
It is a short and atmospheric puzzle game with narration.

Well, puzzle game is a little exaggerated. Search for 4 skulls, 2 left- 2 right on your way to your destination, where you put them on 2 amp ears and then have to turn them a little, where your goal, a cave entrance, is just a few hundred meters?

My text together with the pictures of the advertisement and you know almost the whole game. You can pick mushrooms on the go, or you can leave it.
A relaxing environment awaits you that is well done, but nothing more.
I have no reason why you should play it, but that's your decision. Since there is nothing to complain about, thumbs up.

My group and my archive with over 1,850 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

Gameplay

Das Spiel ist ein Walking Simulator, auch wenn man ein paar Objekte in dem waldbestandenen Tal suchen muss. Die meisten sind auch noch optional.

Ich bin diesem Spielgenre nicht abgeneigt und die Objekte sind auch etwas versteckt, aber dann war es das auch schon. Es fÃ¼hlt sich m.E. an wie eine Demo, Auftakt zu einem vielleicht grÃ¶ÃŸerem, eigentlichen Spiel (vielleicht Nephise). Am Normalpreis bemessen (kostet normal gleich viel) kann ich das kaum glauben.

Der WÃ¤chter der HÃ¶hle 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Keks

Technik

Technisch ist es eigentlich gut ausgestattet, mit der Unreal Engine 4, schÃ¶ner Grafik (inklusive Animation zweier Figuren), sanfter (auf Dauer eintÃ¶niger) Musik und guter (wenn auch spÃ¤rlich agierender) Sprecherin, ControllerunterstÃ¼tzung (aber nicht im MenÃ¼) und umfangreiche Optionen.

Sonstiges

Das Spiel ist in 10 bis 15 Minuten durchgespielt. LÃ¤nger kann es dauern, die optionalen Objekte und damit alle Errungenschaften zu erhalten. Nach 1h war es aber erledigt.

In Zahlen fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 4/10.

Das Spiel wurde in Covid-19-Zeiten kostenlos angeboten, netter Zug, aber fÃ¼r mich hat das "Spiel" einfach zu wenig Inhalt.

Ğ¡Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ° Ğ±ĞµĞ· ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğ°. Ğ¥Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼, Ğ»ÑĞ±ÑƒĞµĞ¼ÑÑ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼ Ğ»ĞµÑĞ¾Ğ¼, ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ ÑĞ²ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ‰Ğ¸ĞµÑÑ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ‹. Ğ”Ğ»Ñ Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾.

Nephise Begins 
Une capture d'Ã©cran de Nephise Begins
Par : Lupus

19 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

RecommandÃ©
0.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

I don't know what kind of mushrooms Nephise was collecting but they were certainly very effective.
Most reviews say that there isn't a story but I disagree, the moral of the story is don't do drugs or you'll start seeing weird things and be addicted for the rest of your life.

A more detailed explanation with spoilers
Nephise collects some glowing mushrooms and starts tripping. First she sees a 3 floor house but with no stairs in it, then she sees a giant fox guarding a cave and decides to collect 4 skulls for that fox to leave; by that point she took 10 mushrooms and is high af. After collecting the 4 skulls the fox flies away.
She then enters the cave and has to solve the easiest puzzle ever which is all in her head, probably because she thinks she's Lara Craft or something and then finds a harpy guarding some sort of orb. The harpy is actually a methead guarding his stack of meth away from Nephise. Absolutely wanting more she kills the harpy/methead and finally discovers the power of the orb/meth and becomes a methead herself, collecting orbs for the rest of her life.
The end
 
Xyoz Quasar

A short but sweet walking sim. Meant to be a prelude to another game, this one does not take very long and is an easy perfect for your collection. The art and atmosphere is very nice and gives you a taste of the full game. It's just a buck so if your looking to chill in some sweet environments for a short bit this can definitely do that for you.

1.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 juillet 2018
'Nephise Begins' is a very relaxing walking simulator that you can finish playing in about one hour. Your goal is to collect items, scattered in a forest and solve two little puzzles.

Some might say that's insufficient for a game, but please consider that the game is very cheap. Although I am not a big fan of walking simulators I enjoy the Nephise games very much.

Pros:
- nice graphics
- good music
- great atmosphere
- mystical
- good narrator
- somehow makes you feel really good
- a giant fox
- very relaxing
- easy achievements
- cheap

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- short
- you can only collect one of the three steam collector cards in one hour

Nephise Begins est le 2Ã¨me opus d'une trilogie, (je ne possÃ¨de que celui-ci et ne pense pas qu'il y ait besoin d'avoir jouÃ© au premier pour comprendre...) axÃ©e simulateur de marche.

Vous Ãªtes directement propulsÃ© dans un bois, et comprenez rapidement que le but sera de collecter 10 champignons rouges et 4 squelettes d'animaux. Deux petites Ã©nigmes toutes simples devront Ãªtre rÃ©solues pour vous dÃ©bloquer certains chemins.
Une histoire en arriÃ¨re plan est narrÃ©e par une voix fÃ©minine (que j'ai trouvÃ©e nasillarde et peu engageante). Celle-ci se rÃ©sume en 4 Ã  5 phrases Ã  tout casser et ne relate rien de franchement intÃ©ressant.

Le tout se termine en environ 1h. J'y ai passÃ© presque 3 heures car je n'ai pas du tout le sens de l'orientation et j'ai galÃ©rÃ© lors de ma recherche de champignons, de plus n'ayant pas vu d'options permettant de sauvegarder, je prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© laisser tourner le jeu plutÃ´t que de perdre ma progression et devoir tout recommencer de zÃ©ro.

De ce fait j'ai fais des pauses plus ou moins longues et Ã  plusieurs reprises car de une je m'y suis ennuyÃ©e et de 2 mÃªme en modifiant la sensibilitÃ© de la souris dans les options, ce jeu m'a donnÃ© le tournis ainsi que des maux de tÃªte Ã  cause de cet effet de personnage qui tangue en marchant.

Je ne le recommande pas car Ã  part dÃ©ambuler dans un bois Ã  collecter des trucs, visiter une pauvre maison qui de l'extÃ©rieur a l'air grande mais finalement ne possÃ¨de qu'une piÃ¨ce digne d'une Ã©table Ã  charbon, et Ã©couter un semblant d'histoire inintÃ©ressante, mis Ã  part ses graphismes il n'y a franchement rien d'agrÃ©able Ã  retirer de cette expÃ©rience.


Visitez mes diffÃ©rentes pages de curation :
ClicK Story---> jeux d'aventure Point and Click IndÃ©pendance Games---> jeux indÃ©pendants AnxioGames---> l'horreur absolue Si l'une d'entre elles vous intÃ©resse n'oubliez pas de cliquer sur le bouton SUIVRE Bonne lecture et bon amusement Ã  toutes et Ã  tous
 
kamikaze62
5,515 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
16 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 aout 2017
Nephise Begins is the prequel to Nephise, and a small, encapsulated vision of Nephise's journey to become an Orb Hunter. As far as Tonguc Bodur's catalog goes, this one was probably my least favorite, and yet it still carries a lot of appeal as its own entity.

Story

As mentioned above, this is the prequel to the game Nephise, and in Nephise Begins, we get to see how she becomes an Orb Hunter. While the significance of such is still left a mystery, it is a satisfying explanation as to how she found her way to the events of Nephise and why she has issues with excess (or addiction, if you will).

She starts out as a mushroom hunter, but as she starts to find the skulls of the dead, she is drawn into an adventure to find the origins of said doom.

7 out of 10

Gameplay

As with Nephise, Nephise Begins is set in a small and encapsulated, circular area that she will explore to find mushrooms and animal skulls, which are also the impetus for her finding the path to becoming an Orb Hunter.

This is exactly the same style of gameplay as Nephise and similar to other of Tonguc's entries. As such, you can expect a seamless experience with no bugs or glitching.

There is one primary puzzle much as with its predecessor, and this is easily solved, yet clever in its design and application.

All in all, solid effort here. 9.5 out of 10

Graphics

The graphics in Nephise Begins is where I really see an actual decline from previous entries. Running with the same specs on each game, Nephise Begins was far less distinct and crisp as previous entries. The colors were a bit more blurred, and everything had a less vibrant feel about them (outside of the skulls and mushrooms which really popped in contrast to everything else). I don't know if this was a conscious decision so as to emphasize the mushrooms and skulls, but it just wasn't as effective in my estimation as it could have been. Some of the other stuff, like the guardian fox and the harpy were quite nice looking, and the temple was really cool. So, it is still a visually pleasing game. Just not at the level I expected it to be.

8 out of 10

Audio

The audio tracks in Nephise Begins aren't too different than in Nephise itself. The old lady narrator was the same and the orchestration was at least similar. Everything was as such both effective and pleasing.

9 out of 10

Verdict

It might seem I'm a bit down on Nephise Begins but I'm really not. It's still a definite cool experience. I just wasn't AS pleased with it as with past efforts by Tonguc. This game still rates highly though.

8.4 out of 10. Must play experience for walking simulator fans.

If you found this review helpful and would be interested in supporting my Curator group, it would be appreciated. Cheers. https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32549618/
 
robilar5500

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 novembre 2021
Se trata de un walking simulator sencillito, de mapa pequeÃ±o que parece como un ensayo de juego. De todas formas, estÃ¡ muy bien terminado, la voz de la narradora es muy profesional, la historia.. de lo rara que es se podria decir que es curiosa, pero vamos es hueca, surrealista, no tiene historia en si.
Tiene cromos, y unos logros que se pueden conseguir, sobretodo â™¥â™¥â™¥ la ayuda de alguna guia.

Para mi el apartado grÃ¡fico estÃ¡ normal, bosque y cuatro cosas mÃ¡s. Pero lo que para mi destaca es la musica. Tiene acordes o notas o sonidos que me recuedan a la banda sonora del king of dragon pass y como es un juego que me gusta bastante pues me resulta muy agradable.

Pilladlo para jugar un rato de tranquis tomando un te y en oferta.
 
JChaos
418 produits enregistrÃ©s

13 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 fÃ©vrier 2020
This is a good title to pick up if you are not familiar with Mr Bodur's walking simulators. This isn't his best, but it also isn't his worst. It is fairly short and contains most of the hallmarks of his titles. Specifically, he is known for assembling assets to create often stunning landscapes, minor trophy hunting, and light puzzles. This title is extremely short and all of the aforementioned elements are scaled back. This is certainly not his best looking title but it will give you a really good idea if you like his style.

I own most of Mr Bodur's titles and although I am often critical, it is because I see a lot of talent on display. I won't critique this one too much because I've taken a couple of years to get around to playing it. I will say that this is an extremely simple title, and Mr Bodur's more recent work sometimes frustrates because he's still learning how to do puzzles and the scripts & dialogue might lose a bit in translation into English. That said, he is talented, and I enjoy most of his work and recommend Nephise Begins as a good choice to introduce yourself to his work.
 
MLV

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 fÃ©vrier 2021
My take on this is thats its obviously a tech demo for some guys resume. Its ultra short and has little to no gameplay out of a nice looking/sounding walking simulator.

The 40mins it took to 100% this game was due to the snails pail walking speed otherwise it would probably have been done in 15mins.

At least given such short gameplay anyone silly enough to waste their money could probably refund as its under steams 2hour policy :D

N2O / LSD == NaN å—¯ï¼Œä¼¼ä¹ä¹Ÿåªæœ‰æ‰“æ°”æ‰èƒ½ç¼“è§£æˆ‘ç°åœ¨çš„ç—›è‹¦äº†

10-24ï¼š
ä¿®å¤äº†è¯„æµ‹ä¸­ä½¿ç”¨é”™è¯¯çš„åˆ é™¤çº¿ä»£ç çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼ˆå–‚
ç°åœ¨æ²¡æ‰“æŠ˜å–11å…ƒï¼Œèµ¶ä¸Šæ‰“æŠ˜+ç›´æ¥ä¹°åˆé›†åŒ…ä»·æ ¼è¿˜å¯ä»¥ã€‚ä¸è¿‡æœ‰é’±ä¸æ˜¯åº”è¯¥å…ˆç»™ä¸€äº›å¤§ä½œè¡¥ç¥¨ä¹ˆ

================================

After finished "playing" all 6 installations, I still don't think I have learned anything.
In these worlds, it's kill or be killed.
Since they are walking simulators, you don't prossess any weapons for personal defense. Especially in this one, after you jumped onto the 5 pieces of rock, you are not rewarded a Ray Gun. However for Nephise and Nephise Begins, players surely are able to kill one enemy in each of them. Just touch them and stay there for at least 92 frames and that's done.
But before players can approach them, they had to keep themselves from getting dizzy. The headbobbing effect can be turned off, but the beautiful lights and shadows can still make them painful, even in Bottle where almost the whole world is covered in white. And furthermore, Bottle, Nephise and Nephise Begins all contain only one map in each installation, and don't offer a save function, so players have to painfully get it through in one run. or stop and take a break in the middle. Drizzlepath Glass did the best job on this point, since at least it doesn't make players so dizzy, and can auto-save after each map which is the same after all.
Nitrous / LSD == NaN Well, it seems that only inhaling some nitrous can help with my current pain

10-24:
Fixed all wrong codes of strike-throughs in this review. (Oh come on
Currently its labelled 11 Yuan without a sale (which is probably not the same in your region if you're not Chinese), so it's okay to buy the whole pack on sale. But shouldn't we pay for some played masterpieces first, if we really have enough money?
 
null

Ğ¢ĞµĞ¿ĞµÑ€ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ½ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµÑĞ° Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ ÑĞ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ»ĞµÑÑƒ Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ñ‡ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¿Ğ°. Ğ˜ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ€ÑƒÑˆĞºĞ°, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·ĞºĞ¸ Ğº Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞºĞµ Ñ Ğ°Ğ¼Ñ„Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ (Ğ² Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ Ğ±Ñ‹Ğ»Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ñ‚ÑƒĞ¸). Nephise Begins
Laufsimulator

Der zweite Teil der Reihe soll uns erzÃ¤hlen, was Nephise vor ihrem ersten "Abenteuer" erlebt hat. Ehrlich gesagt erfÃ¤hrt man hier nur sehr wenig, auÃŸer dass sie aus irgendwelchen GrÃ¼nden rote Pilze sammelt und alles weitere bringt auch keine besseren Erkenntnisse, da nicht viel bzw. nichts erzÃ¤hlt wird. WÃ¤hrend in Teil 1 noch anfangs eine ErzÃ¤hlerin auftrat, hÃ¶rt man hier nur sporadisch gesprochene SÃ¤tze.

Diese Lauf-Sim bietet diesmal nur eine einigermaÃŸen zufriedenstellende Grafik. Ich hatte den Eindruck, dass der Entwickler hier geschludert hat oder einfach nur schnell fertig werden wollte. Farblich ist es meist braun in braun gehalten, was einen sehr langweiligen Eindruck macht.
VidÃ©o YouTubeâ„¢: Nephise Begins Review 
Vues : 2,455
Nephise Begins tells the player what happened at the time before Nephise was an orb collector. The main setting is forest again, but this time without snow, instead a more sunny and foggy weather.

Was die Musik angeht bin ich zwiegespalten. Ein Teil klingt nach mittelalterlicher Musik, die mir nicht gefallen hat, was an den seltsamen KlÃ¤ngen von undefinierbaren "Instrumenten" lag, Die weitere Musik trÃ¤gt aber dann den Erkundungsgang wieder - ich nenne sie mal lieblich, der Stimmung eines trockenen sommerlichen Nadelwaldes entsprechend.

An Handlung ist Lauf-Sim-typisch wenig zu erwarten. Man kann Pilze und etwas fÃ¼r eine Errungenschaft sammeln, muss es aber nicht. Alle weiteren GegenstÃ¤nde sind Teile der LÃ¶sung des einzigen "RÃ¤tsels", dessen LÃ¶sung mehr oder weniger im Spiel verraten wird. Tipp: Ist man in der NÃ¤he eines dieser GegenstÃ¤nde, wird ein Symbol im ausschaltbaren HUD angezeigt, d.h. die Richtung, in der sich der Gegenstand befindet.

Nach etwa 60 Min. war ich am Ziel. Die Sim hat mich etwas verstÃ¤ndnislos zurÃ¼ck gelassen, da eine Geschichte angekÃ¼ndigt war und nichts dergleichen passierte. Grafisch war sie ein RÃ¼ckschritt und musikalisch ebenso. Auch wenn der Preis niedrig ist: diese Laufsim kann ich leider nicht empfehlen.

Ğ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğº Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ° Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚. ĞÑƒ Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ» Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾. Ğ¡Ğ¾Ğ±ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼Ñƒ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑĞ°Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚ÑŒ??? ĞŸĞ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¿Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€ĞµĞºĞ¾Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ», Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ² ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ½ĞµÑĞµÑ‚. ĞĞ¾ ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ ĞµĞµ Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¸ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ ÑĞ»ÑƒÑˆĞ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºÑƒ Ğ¸ ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºĞ¸))))

3 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante

Non recommandÃ©
0.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 novembre 2020
What the hell is this?
You just start in the middle of nowhere and a narrator calls you Nelphise for no reason and make you collect mushrooms and skulls. The view which takes place in forest is not bad but you can't run so the whole process is very tedious. It doesn't support saving but you can understand immediately as the game ends real quick and abruptly. The whole story didn't make sense at all and frankly as one of walking simulators, i don't think this stands out at all. it was boring.
But it made me think taking a walk in the woods with my dogs would be better than playing games. So that's something but not good enough to give a good rating. So not recommended.

ä¹‹å‰å‘è¡Œå•†TonguÃ§ Boduråšæ´»åŠ¨é€äº†ä¸€ä»½ï¼ŒTonguÃ§ Boduræ˜¯ä¸ªç‹¬ç«‹æ¸¸æˆå¼€å‘äººï¼Œä»¥å‰æ˜¯åšå›¾å½¢è®¾è®¡çš„ï¼Œ14å¹´å¼€å§‹åšæ¸¸æˆã€‚Steamåˆ—è¡¨æ˜¾ç¤ºä»–åšçš„åŸºæœ¬éƒ½æ˜¯çœ‹é£æ™¯çš„æ¸¸æˆï¼Œå¤–åŠ å°‘é‡æƒ…æ„Ÿæ•…äº‹ã€‚æœ¬ä½œæ˜¯ã€ŠNephiseã€‹çš„å‰ä¼ ï¼Œè®²è¿°äº†Nephise æˆä¸ºçƒä½“æ”¶é›†è€…ä¹‹å‰å‘ç”Ÿçš„äº‹æƒ…ï¼Œä¸è¿‡æˆ‘æ²¡ç©è¿‡å‰ä½œï¼Œåªèƒ½å¯¹æœ¬ä½œæµ‹è¯„ã€‚

æˆ‘ä»¬ä¸€å¼€å§‹å¾—çŸ¥è‡ªå·±æ˜¯æ¥é’ˆå°–æ£®æ—é‡‡è˜‘è‡çš„ï¼Œæ²¡èµ°å‡ æ­¥ä¼šç¢°åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªåªèƒ½è¿›ä¸€å±‚çš„ä¸‰å±‚å°æ¥¼ï¼Œé‡‡äº†å‡ æœµè˜‘è‡åä¼šå‘ç°ä¸€åªå·¨å‹ç‹ç‹¸æŠŠå®ˆç€é“è·¯ï¼Œæ¸¸æˆç›®æ ‡å°±å˜æˆäº†æ‰¾åˆ°å››ä¸ªåŠ¨ç‰©å¤´éª¨ã€‚æ¥ä¸‹æ¥å°±æ˜¯æ¸¸æˆä¸­éå¸¸æ— èŠçš„æ‰¾é“å…·éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦é€›éæ•´ä¸ªåœ°å›¾æ‰¾åˆ°å››ä¸ªå¤´éª¨ã€‚æ‰¾åˆ°åï¼Œè½¬åŠ¨ç½å­åšä¸€ä¸ªæå…¶ç®€å•çš„è§£è°œï¼Œå·¨å‹ç‹ç‹¸å°±ä¼šç¦»å¼€ï¼Œéœ²å‡ºä¸€ä¸ªæ´ç©´ã€‚è¸©ä¸‹å‡ å—çŸ³æ¿åè¿›å…¥æ›´æ·±å¤„ï¼Œé‡Œé¢æœ‰ä¸ªç¥åº™ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­æœ‰ä¸€åªé¸Ÿèº«äººè„¸æ€ªç‰©ï¼Œä¸€ç¢°å°±æ­»äº†ï¼Œç„¶åæ¸¸æˆä¹Ÿå°±æ­¤ç»“æŸã€‚

ä»æˆ‘çš„ç®€è¿°å°±å¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºï¼Œæ¸¸æˆçš„å†…å®¹éå¸¸å°‘ï¼Œä¸”ä¸çŸ¥æ‰€äº‘ã€‚æˆ‘å¤§æ¦‚èŠ±äº†40å¤šåˆ†é’Ÿæ‰“å®ŒåŠ å…¨æˆå°±ï¼Œæ„Ÿè§‰å…¶ä¸­ç»å¤§éƒ¨åˆ†æ˜¯åœ¨æ‰¾é“å…·ã€‚æ•´ä¸ªæ¸¸æˆçš„ä¼˜ç‚¹å¯èƒ½å°±æ˜¯çœ‹çœ‹é£æ™¯ï¼Œä½“éªŒåœ¨é›¨åæ£®æ—èµ°æ¥èµ°å»çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ã€‚ä¸è¿‡ï¼Œæ•´ä¸ªæ¸¸æˆçš„æ‰¾ä¸œè¥¿éƒ¨åˆ†ä»¤äººçƒ¦èºï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å½“ç„¶å¯ä»¥é€‰æ‹©åªæ‰¾4ä¸ªå¤´éª¨ï¼Œä½†æˆ‘ä¼°è®¡ç»å¤§å¤šæ•°ç©å®¶è¿˜æ˜¯ä¼šä¸ºäº†å…¨æˆå°±å»æ‰¾é½10ä¸ªè˜‘è‡å’Œå­—æ¯Nã€‚æ¸¸æˆå…è®¸æˆ‘ä»¬æ´»åŠ¨çš„åŒºåŸŸè¿˜ä¸å°ï¼Œå¾—çˆ¬ä¸¤å¤„å±±å¡ï¼Œæˆ‘ç©çš„æ—¶å€™åªæ‰¾åˆ°9ä¸ªè˜‘è‡ï¼Œæœ€åä¸€ä¸ªç»•è€ç»•å»æ‰¾äº†å¥½ä¹…ï¼Œå‡ ä¹è€—å°½äº†æˆ‘çš„è€æ€§ã€‚æ¸¸æˆå†…å‡ ä¹æ‰€æœ‰æ–‡å­—éƒ½æ¥è‡ªä¸€ä½ä¸­å¹´å¥³æ€§çš„è¯­éŸ³ï¼Œè™½ç»™äºˆäº†æ¸¸æˆè¿‡ç¨‹å¿…è¦çš„å¼•å¯¼ï¼Œä½†ä»æ— æ³•å¾—çŸ¥æ¸¸æˆçš„ç›®çš„æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Œä¹Ÿè®¸æ˜¯è·Ÿå‰ä½œæœ‰å…³å§ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯èƒ½è¿™å°±æ˜¯ä½œè€…è¿½æ±‚çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ã€‚æˆ‘åº”è¯¥ä¸ä¼šå»å°è¯•å‰ä½œï¼Œè¿™é‡Œç»™å‡ºçš„å¥½è¯„ä¹Ÿä¸å…·å¤‡æŒ‡å¯¼æ„ä¹‰ã€‚

RecommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 juin 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

note: i grabbed this game when it was given away for free on steam recently.

it's a beautiful, calm and relaxing walking simulator with light narration, an easy puzzle (yes, one) and some stuff to collect. it's not special in any way but then again there is nothing wrong with it either.

you can't save at all but that's sort of ok since finishing and 100% completing the game took 26 minutes. is that worth 2â‚¬?
i doubt it. however it certainly made me curious about the other two nephise games.

i did not buy or play the other two games yet but i guess it's safe to assume that you should either get all three nephise games at a serious discount or not bother with any of them at all.
i will recommend this for now as long as the other games don't turn out to be horrible.



forward to my review of Nephise:
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Meister_Leuchte/recommended/606860/
 
Meister_Leuchte
1,137 produits enregistrÃ©s

16 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 avril 2017
Released just a month after its prequel Nephise Begins tells how our protagonist became an orb collector in the first place. The setting is pretty much the same: a meticulously created forest where the attention to detail is superb! As opposed to Nephise the season is now summer which, naturally, provides more opportunities to showcase the 4th iteration of the Unreal engine.

While the forest is the main setting a little puzzle-solving allows us to proceed to a cave where our journey comes to an end. This was actually pretty similar in Nephise - it matters not as the main emphasis is still on strolling in the forest and climbing the various plateaus to get our hands on more collectible items. Our promenade, at all times, is accompanied by great music and as you get close to your goal you constantly wish for more.

Nephise Begins - similarly to Nephise - is mainly for two types of people: for those who love walking sims and for those who are picture aficionados. This is an excellent item in your library to increase the number of screenshots you have in the cloud.
 
CorvusCorax
1,563 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
16 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 mai 2017
A waste of time for me. relaxing maybe, in very meditative way... but sitting in a room staring at a wall can be relaxing too, antd i can have that for free.

I really injoy walking simulators if they are done properly. but this one doesn't have a proper story, which is usually the interesting part. Instead it has what a lot of walking simulators are missing: primitive gaming elements. the problem is that they are boring and just stop you from progressing without reason or explanation. Walk through a level that has barely any landmarks and find random stuff because a voice tells you to. then step on 5 platforms.

but to be fair: it looks good most of the time, apart from a few glitches. It feels like the job application of a level designer: "look, i can handle UE4, even managed to get a few gaming elements and a gui in there!" thats fine, but nothing I would pay any money for again.
 
Daniel

Genre
Ein Story Driven First Person Exploration Adventure/Walking Simulator

Story
Das Spiel spielt von der Handlung her noch vor dem Ersten Teil "Nephise" und erzÃ¤hlt die Geschichte wie Sie zu einem Sammler/Sammlerin wurde

Gameplay
Wir laufen durch einen Wald und mÃ¼ssen 4 Tier SchÃ¤del sammeln damit der WÃ¤chter uns in die HÃ¶hle lÃ¤sst. Unterwegs kÃ¶nnen wir auch Rote Pilze einsammeln die aber nur fÃ¼r ein Achievement gut sind. Die Grafik sieht gut aus und die Musik & der Sound sind passend

Achievements
Es gibt insgesamt 5 Erfolge. Eins ist Story basierend und somit nicht verpassbar. Die anderen gibt es fÃ¼rs beenden des Spiels, fÃ¼rs sammeln von 10 Roten Pilzen, fÃ¼rs finden des Versteckten "N" und das letzte gibt es fÃ¼rs viermalige drehen einer Statue in dem Haus

Pro/Contra
+ Nette AtmosphÃ¤re
+ Musik & Sound sind passend
+ Voice Acting OK
+ Kurz
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

- Es gibt keine Sprint Funktion

Fazit
Ein Netter Kurzer Walking Simulator mit SchÃ¶nen Achievements. Durchaus zu Empfehlen

Nephise est donc une adepte des champignons hallucinogÃ¨nes, et une alcoolique. Bien bien.

Nephise Begins, sorti en 2017, est un FPS simulateur de marche oÃ¹ l'on incarne Nephise, avant le premier opus, qui est Ã  la recherche de champignons pour kiffer ses soirÃ©es d'hiver.

Ce prequel est bien plus satisfaisant !
On apprend comment notre drojÃ© alcoolique voit des boules rouges, et est devenu acro Ã  ces derniÃ¨res, la forÃ§ant Ã  continuer Ã  en chercher, encore et encore.
Contrairement au premier, Nephise Begins est mieux rÃ©ussi tant par les graphismes, que la musique et l'ambiance. Le jeu est plus soignÃ© (bien que quelques rochers un peu baveux ont Ã©tÃ© aperÃ§us), dÃ©taillÃ© et plus intÃ©ressant.
L'histoire est toujours aussi chelou, mais je vous laisse la dÃ©couvrir par vous-mÃªme.
Les Ã©nigmes sont encore plus simples que le premier, et tout aussi longues en recherche d'items Ã  collecter.
On a donc une durÃ©e de vie d'environ 30-45min, en fonction de vous, si vous faites l'effort de collecter tous les items ou non.

N.B. :

- Evaluation du jeu Nephise --> Voir ici

Conclusion :

Bref, c'est mieux rÃ©ussi que le premier, plus beau, plus intÃ©ressant Ã  explorer. Un chouilla plus de travail, et on tient un jeu un peu plus potable. Mais en promo, Ã§a se tente.

0
16 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 3 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

A delightful little game. It reminded me of Skyrim, except that instead of looking for Nirnroot and veins of copper or silver, you are looking for mushrooms and animal skulls. The visuals are quite stunning, and it was enjoyable completing the fox's quest and seeing the fox fly away. Completing the game takes roughly 90 minutes.

Some might quibble about the game and go "What was the point of that?" Well, what's the point of any game? To pass the time and amuse yourself for a moment. This game succeeded on that score quite admirably.

 
Aglet Green

Party Poison
0
6 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 mai 2020
Nephise Begins

This is a game where we start playing in the forest. We don't know who we are or what to do. During our wandering through the forest we find mushrooms and skulls and a deserted house. At some point a big fox appears to our eyes, which defends the entrance to the cave. If we have picked up the skulls and put them well in amphorae in front of the fox, it will fly away(?). Then we enter the cave, where we meet a character and the game ends. The whole thing takes about half an hour.

It's worth asking ourselves if even for such a low price it's worth buying this game just to come half an hour through the forest and collect some items. If it would be an introduction to the full version of the game, I would definitely recommend it, but it is released as a separate game.

Someone will say that we can relax in the game by walking in the forest and he's a bit right, because the soundtrack and graphics are good. But just walking in the forest is not enough.

Summary

Nephise Begins is a game that was relaxing on the one hand, but on the other hand it offers nothing interesting. Collecting mushrooms and skulls, and thus completing the game takes less time than some demo versions of games. This game should definitely be free despite its low price.

âœ”ï¸Graphics
âœ”ï¸Soundtrack
âœ”ï¸Relaxing

âŒApart from walking, we won't experience anything else in the game
âŒBoring
âŒIncomprehensible storyline
âŒToo short

Time of completion: 0,5-1 hour

Rating: 4.5/10

Follow my curator for more reviews

ATTENTION!
Please note that this is only my evaluation and opinion of the game. If you do not agree with it or think that the game deserves a higher or lower rating, please leave a comment and I will be happy to respond.

Es raro, no sÃ© si recomendarlo del todo o no. Lo comprÃ© en una rebaja del 50%, y gracias a los cromos obtenidos durante la partida, pude recuperar totalmente lo invertido en Ã©l. Creo que, sÃ³lo por eso, voy a darle un pulgar arriba; de haber sentido que paguÃ© por esto, no estarÃ­a tan seguro.
En primer lugar, el juego se ve tan hermoso como su predecesor. Los ambientes estÃ¡n excelentemente bien diseÃ±ados, tanto desde lo visual como desde lo sonoro. Durante la hora que puede tomar acabar el juego, deambularemos por un bosque perfectamente recreado, explorÃ¡ndolo, conociÃ©ndolo, perdiÃ©ndonos en Ã©l hasta lograr ubicarnos. Uno de los problemas, respecto del juego anterior, es que el mapa es mucho mÃ¡s confuso debido a que existen muchos menos puntos de referencia. Por suerte, en esta ediciÃ³n se incluyÃ³ una suerte de brÃºjula (sin los puntos cardinales marcados) que nos orienta cuando nos acercamos a alguno de los objetivos. El problema de la inmersiÃ³n de la entra anterior, sigue presente; dicha inmersiÃ³n se quiebra cuando nos hacemos las preguntas "quiÃ©n soy? por quÃ© estoy acÃ¡? por quÃ© hago lo que hago?" y, dejenme adelantarles, el juego no se molesta en contestarlas. Otra vez. Cuando acaba, lo hace de manera abrupta y poco satisfactoria, pero tampoco tanto como para opacar el relax que implica todo el camino previo. Y es que quizÃ¡s ese sea el verdadero juego.
 
JulioTulio

Non recommandÃ©
0.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 novembre 2018
Produit remboursÃ©

Follow "First Person Exploration and Puzzle Games" for more games like this!
An extremely short walking-simulator, and the sequel to the 2017 game Nephise.

Like its predecessor, you walk around a procedurally pre-generated environment consisting mostly of copy+pasted assets while a narrator reads poorly-written dialog. The map is bigger and even more poorly designed this time, still lacking almost all contextual clues hinting at where you need to go. The game takes 15-60 minutes to beat, depending on how long you decide to wander around aimlessly before looking up a guide.

If you liked the first one, you'll probably like this one, but I suspect most people won't enjoy it.
 
BlueRaja

Played on Linux with Proton, smooth experience without any issues.

It's more of a tech demo than a game, walking simulator to be precise.

It's very pretty and chill though. However, It's quite short, expect about an hour of entertainment. Give the price + length, I would still recommend it.

TUVE
6
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 janvier 2023
This game is even worse than the original in almost all aspects. Even though the setting is completely different, the graphics are quite bad this time, with a very unnatural lighting and frequently glitched textures. The story is almost inexistent and really basic and horrible, the narrating voice is still very unpleasant and walking in this game is unbelievably slow. Also the music is worse than in the original and extremely repetitive, apart from the ending where it gets slightly better, although the entire ending sequence is probably the most appalling and embarassing I have ever seen in a videogame. Only good for the achievements...
 
Leo_M_

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 mai 2018
Better than the first Nephise, this one is at least more expansive, but much of the same simplicity of the first. You can tell TonguÃ§ Bodur is getting better at using UE4, but still not excellent. Without knowing what he is responsible for, I must imagine he is using a bunch of free assets to create these games. Nothing against that, but the disjointed nature of the story leads me to believe that is what he is doing. Almost a thumbs up, but not quite there yet. Maybe Nephise: Ascension is improved enough to get a thumbs up.

Wonderful game! Graphics is enchanting. I love strolls in the forest and here is everything what I love in them: tall trees, rocks, wonderful sun reflections etc. Further more we have a relaxing and soothing music in that journey, which has a turkish vibe. I really recommend this game. I'm glad this forest is not that small so we can spend some time on capturing our screenshots! Looking forward to buy more games by TonguÃ§ Bodur!

Advantages:

Graphics.
Soothing music.
It's relaxing.
Story.

Drawbacks:

-

ĞĞ½ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚ĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¸ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°ĞºĞ¾Ğ½Ñ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ·Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ°. ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ» Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ğ° Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿Ğ½Ğ°Ñ. Ğ“Ñ€Ğ°Ñ„Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸ Ñ Ğ½Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ» ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ´Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¼. Ğ›Ğ°Ğ½Ğ´ÑˆĞ°Ñ„Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞºÑ€Ğ°ÑĞµĞ½. ĞÑĞ¾Ğ±ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾, ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ñ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ñƒ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ»Ñ Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºÑƒ. Ğ¯ ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ‚ÑƒÑ.

ĞÑ†ĞµĞ½ĞºĞ°: 8/10

Non recommandÃ©
1.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 novembre 2017
NO SAVE FEATURE. Tedious fetch quests. A rip off.

This is the first time I have seen a game specifically designed to trick people into playing past the two hour refund mark before they discover how badly they've been ripped off.

The price tag may only be $2.00, but that is $2.00 you will never get back for an unfinished game. This should be advertised as early access or should be free to play.

The first thing you will see is a dialogue telling you that because the game is so special, there is no save feature.

That is because if there was a save feature, you might actually be able to handle the long, tedious fetch quest over several sessions. There is nobody alive who hates themselves enough to do the fetch quest in one sitting.

I don't buy that the game is somehow better without a save feature. Don't fall for that trick like I did.


 
HLLCIION

Small walking and collecting game.

- No backstory whatsoever
- You don't want the feeling: you missed one collectible and search all the map multiple time to find

+ Good graphics, Unreal 4
+ Narrator voice

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 juillet 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Jogue com paciÃªncia, pois o personagem controlado (Nephise) Ã© beeem lento e a floresta nÃ£o tem um caminho definido.
Eu diria que Ã© mais um jogo artÃ­stico.
Infelizmente tive que jogar no low, mas vi umas screenshots bem bonitas do jogo.
TambÃ©m Ã© beeem curtinho. Ã‰ "rÃ¡pido" pra completar, o que dÃ¡ mais de trabalho Ã© coletar os cogumelos.

 
Charuru
567 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juin 2022
A relaxing little game for when you're staring at your enormous
Steam library and have "nothing to play"... Paradox of choice...
But here is the answer perhaps... I just felt like playing something
that didn't require any effort whatsoever. Play what you want,
when you want. Never feel obligated to play a certain game or to
even finish it. When the fun stops, stop. Forget about the "backlog"!

A game is a game is a game and games are for fun. A waste of time
(in a good way because in my opinion life is all about wasting time
since everything we do will count for nothing ultimately since we'll be
dead and even if it's all still meaningless) and an escape from this mundane
reality - games should never feel like work. Life is work. But it's also a game.
So I guess there is one game that's partially worth putting the effort into - or not.

It doesn't matter in the end. Some of us don't care about the best DPS and the
best gear or mounts or pets, etc. I'll settle for taking the bus and working a minimum
wage job or being a NEET whilst playing the lottery and hoping I'll win. I'm content.

But anyway back to the review.

This game is almost like meditation in its own way. You walk around slowly (everyone
is in such a rush these days!), explore this mysterious forest and collect mushrooms
and other items. I have heard that mushrooms can help in opening your eyes to the
unseen. We should be funding research into these magic mushrooms I say. Last but not
least, the game has a great soundtrack (soothes the soul) and the overall atmosphere is
just nice. I suppose you have to be different to enjoy a game like this. If you're expecting
a AAA experience - this isn't it. It's a walking simulator and lasts only 45 minutes to 1 hour,
hence the price. It's a prelude to another game......................................Thanks for reading.
 
OniFire

Another very short casual walking simulator that is a prequel to the game called â€œNephiseâ€, featuring colorful autumn valley, collecting skulls for a puzzle to solve, mushrooms picking, and yet another funny parody at a bossfight. This game is almost a copy of the first Nephise, except it feels richer in content and overall is looking better. Good entertainment for an hour or two, and at a favorable price.

Parece una chorrada este tipo de juegos de la mano de Bodur, pero oye molan. Suelen estar en rebajas, y a buen precio, comprando un pack, sinceramente renta. Lo malo, no tiene traduccion, lo bueno, calidad grafica buena e mecanicas agradable. Unas 2h de juego como maximo, para sacarte su 100%, por apenas menos de 1â‚¬, no esta nada nada mal.

0
RecommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 mars 2018
'Nephise Begins' (the follow-up of 'Nephise') is an equally quaint little walking simulator with minor puzzles and items to collect. Like 'Nephise', the game is very short and can be completed in less than an hour at a leisurely pace. It has the same dreamy, mystical atmosphere of its predecessor and relaxing music to complement the visuals.
After having played fast-paced games for a while, it felt good to retreat back into something short, slow and simple yet satisfying.
Meant to be played in one sitting; no save system.

RecommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 dÃ©cembre 2017
The game is simple and fun. It is more like when you went out in nature as a kind and said "I am going to find the best pinecones and rocks." You essentially wander around a wooded area looking for a few items. No maps, no compass, and very little activity in the world. I think this game would have been better if there were other forest animals around in it. Also, the jump isn't very effective. Overall it is worth the sale price I bought it at, but nothing more.

Pros:
* Looks decent, but not amazing
* Simple fun and relaxing
* Just adventuring

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
* Super short, 30 minutes
* No run (would probably make the game 20 minutes)
* Very little dialog
* Small area to explore

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

This game is pretty boring. There is some thought put into it, but it fails as a whole. It could work as a pretty bad benchmark, but there is nothing interesting. Plus, there's no sprint button, so you end up walking super slowly for 45 minutes straight until you touch the harpy, it inexplicably dies and you grab the orb and something happens. There are no subtitles or closed captions, requiring you to listen carefully and to understand the language.

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
Non recommandÃ©
1.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 mai 2017
This game is practically pointless. I enjoy walking simulators, not because I enjoy simulated walking, but rather for what those games provide in addition to navigating a 3D space. That might be interesting narative, exploration, or puzzles. This game has all 3 but without the quality of being interesting. It feels like an unreal license, a handful of decent assets, and a quality voice actor were given to someone who had heard of video games but never played one and decided to make this. The narrator explains the 'puzzles' even though they're so simple no explaination is needed. Why is there a giant fox? Why does the main character collect mushrooms? Why are there floating 'n's? Why is there a harpy in a cathedral in a cave? Nothing is explained because no reasons exist. This is just a bunch of assets cramed together in the framework of a game, but there is no plot and no point. It's all senseless and meaningless. I cannot recommend it.
 
MrDowntempo

Leider absolut nicht das, was ich mir durch die Bilder erhofft habe.

Hier handelt es sich lediglich um einen seeeeehr anstrengenden Walking Simulator. Das kommt mitunter daher, dass der Charakter keine Sprintfunktion verfÃ¼gt und sich daher nur sehr langsam Ã¼ber die Karte bewegen kann. Das Springen verschafft da auch keinen Tempoboost. Die Sammelobjekte, die es zu finden gilt, sind mÃ¼hselig versteckt. Das Finden ist mehr Zufall und hat mit Detektivarbeit nichts zu tun.
Die fehlende Karte trÃ¼bt das "Spielerlebnis" weiter und verweigert jegliche Orientierung innerhalb des Spiels. Das muss vom Spieler selber ausgehen und die EintÃ¶nigkeit der Karte erschwert dies zusÃ¤tzlich. Alle anderen negativen Punkte Ã¼ber- bzw. untertreffend ist die "Story". Plumpes Gelaber aus dem Off quetscht die Geschichte in die letzten 2 Minuten Spielzeit. Abgesehen davon berichtet die Stimme nur wie RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen sind und dass man doch irgendwo im Westen nach den Sammelobjekten gucken. Ein Kompass fehlt natÃ¼rlich.

Alles in allem bin ich froh, dass ich hierfÃ¼r kein Geld ausgegeben habe und kann nur jedem davon abraten, der in der Ãœberlegung ist, das zu tun.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 septembre 2020
I grabbed Nephise Begins while it was free on Steam earlier in the year, and finally got around to playing it. Itâ€™s a prequel to Nephise, a game I havenâ€™t played. If Iâ€™m honest, I wasnâ€™t expecting much, and as it turns out there wasnâ€™t really much to the game, but at the same time it had a surprising charm to it.

I started off in a wood, collecting mushrooms, so naturally I went exploring the entire wood looking for them. Unfortunately, Iâ€™m not sure this was the expected/intended route, as I ended up finding different items and areas that hadnâ€™t been explained or introduced. I did later find where I imagine I should have gone first, and things began to make a little more sense, but the story was still incredibly lacking, almost to the point of nonexistence.

Itâ€™s a basic walking simulator, so the gameplay side of things is very basic. You walk around to explore, you can jump to help climb some of the hills, and you can click to pick up objects needed to progress through the game. Nothing particularly out of the ordinary for a simple walking simulator.

What it did well, however, was create a relaxing experience while playing. The graphics were nice, the music soothing, and the narratorâ€™s voice seemed perfect for what little was mentioned. The HUD display toggle was nice for enhancing the exploration experience and taking screenshots. It wasnâ€™t until I started a second playthrough, to get the achievement I missed the first time around, where I began to find it a little tedious.

While Nephise Begins was relaxing for a while, itâ€™s not something Iâ€™d go out of my way to buy or play. If there had been more to the story and narration, I feel it couldâ€™ve been pretty great, but as it is, thereâ€™s not a great deal going for it. For someone wanting a casual half an hour of exploration with little substance or meaning, maybe as a break from a more intense game, it could be worth trying, but I wouldnâ€™t recommend going out of the way to play this for any other reason. Of course, for achievements hunters or completionists, itâ€™s a cheap and quick game to 100%.

For more reviews follow Gawain Games Curator Page and check out the Gawain Games Website[gawain-games.com]. You can also find my review on We The Players[wetheplayers.com].
 
Gawain112
