FauxMellow
328 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 aout 2022
Nephise Begins

Positives:
+ Awesome graphics
+ Nice sound and music
+ Beautiful landscape and cave
+ A fairytale like atmosphere
+ FOV adjustment option
+ Jump function
+ Easier puzzles than previous game

Negatives:
- The jumping is not high enough
- Quite difficult to find all the skulls and mushrooms
- Not enough hints on where everything is
- Draw distance is not the best (landscapes keep changing when you approach)
- Very short
- Slow walking speed and no run function

This game is a bit better than the original Nephise.
It has a more beautiful landscape and easier puzzles.

Total Score: 7/10
 
ArHiT
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 aout 2022
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Even for a walking sim, this game is horrendously boring...

You take a stroll through a plain looking forest, crawling your way across an unnecessarily large map, continue to get lost for for 15 minutes, and eventually find one of the way too many collectibles.
The entire point of the game (from what I gathered) is to simply find 4 animal skulls and put them on some pots, to then go into the cave that's being guarded by a giant fox... for some reason?

This game has no story at all, boring narration, absolutely 0 guidance on where you should be going, or even where you are. And the only thing with the least bit of waypointing, would be said animal skulls. - Which have a marker if you get close enough.

Needless to say I did not enjoy thiss mess of a game, and heavily suggest not buying it.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 25 juillet 2022
Very short relaxing game to showcase the capabilities of Unreal Engine 4. Nothing more, nothing less. Not much of an origin story but the previous game in a new atmosphere (no snow, different colour palette). Would recommend if you like relaxing in a beautifully rendered forest and possbily taking some pictures.

Jeu rÃ©alisÃ© en 25 minutes Ã  100% tranquillement.
C'est beau, on doit collecter 4 cranes et 10 champignons (et un "n"), les commandes sont simples (juste le dÃ©placement et clic gauche). La narration est anecdotique.
Pourquoi on doit ramasser des champignons ? pourquoi le personnage se dÃ©place si bizarrement ? Pourquoi il y a une maison bizarre, un renard gÃ©ant qui s'envole ? Trop de question pour aussi peu de temps de jeu.
AprÃ¨s le jeu ne vaut que 80 centimes pour 30 minutes. Il fait partie d'une trilogie mais l'histoire ne me donne pas envie d'acheter les autres meme si le prix est trÃ¨s bas.
Tester un des trois opus et vous verrez si vous voulez faire la suite.

J'ai l'impression que le dev rÃ©alise beaucoup de jeu de ce genre, "relaxant" avec une bonne musique. Regardez les autres jeux, il y en a peut Ãªtre des mieux et plus longs.

Guten Tag meine Lieben,

Nephise Begins ist ein kleines sÃ¼ÃŸes Mini-Storygame fÃ¼r ca. 20 Minuten BeschÃ¤ftigung fÃ¼r 79 Cent.

Man spielt ein MÃ¤dchen namens Nephise. Aufgabe ist es einen Wald zu erkunden. Bei dieser Erkundung gibt es 14 GegenstÃ¤nde zum sammeln, 4 davon storyrelevant, 10 optional.

Wie die Story weitergeht mÃ¼sst ihr selbst herausfinden :P

Der Soundtrack ist sehr angenehm und passend zur AtmosphÃ¤re. Die Grafik ist Ã¼berraschend gut fÃ¼r solch ein Minigame und vergleichbar etwa mit der Grafik in "The Forest".

FÃ¼r den Preis macht man da fÃ¼r zwischendurch absolut nichts verkehrt.

MÃ¼sst ihr wissen.

Review zu Nephise Begins

Ein weiteres Exemplar der Kategorie Walking Simulator. Man lÃ¤uft durch die kleine und detailarme Spielwelt und sammelt Pilze und TierschÃ¤del. Letztere sind fÃ¼r die "Story" - wenn man das so nennen kann - essentiell.
Bei der Suche nach dem letzten Pilz (ja, ich habe keinen Guide benutzt) kam dann doch relativ schnell Frust auf. Allerdings sind die Pilze glÃ¼cklicherweise optional. Alles in allem ein sehr kurzes, aber auch ziemlich langweiliges Spiel. Weder Grafik noch Musik reiÃŸen BÃ¤ume (von denen es in Nephise Begins sehr viele gibt) aus. Je nachdem wie man sich anstellt hat man innerhalb von 0,5 - 1 h die 100% erreicht. Muss man nicht gespielt haben.

I finished it in 25.5 min with all 5 achievements w/o looking at any guides.

Frame rate was kinda choppy at max settings, 1440p, despite my rig. (12th gen Intel Core i7, 32 GB, 3070Ti, SSD).

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 mars 2022
The game is just plain bad, maybe even worse than the first one. The forrest is boring, with nothing special to see, it's not even especially nice to look at. The fox is UGLY as f***, same with th harpy. The whole point of the game is to collect 10 mushrooms and 4 skulls. Even with getting lost and walking over the whole map thrice it only took me 30 minutes to finsih.

The whole "story" is just ridiculous and stupid, save your money and time, don't get this "game".

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 mars 2022
Nephise Begins is a beautiful exploration and walking sim. Traverse a rather small area of a forested valley, collect mushrooms and animal skulls, investigate an abandoned but tidy house, and stay a healthy distance away from the giant fox blocking a rather interesting and mythical looking cave lest you get eaten.

30+ min to complete, despite this game being about how Nephise started on her orb collecting adventure series, the actual story isâ€¦ disappointing and sparse; the ending is strange and quick. Despite its faults, I canâ€™t really give this a negative review because the game is cheap and the graphics are gorgeous; I did like walking around for 30 min taking screenshots.
 
Zelrune

ybarion81
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 fÃ©vrier 2022
Nephise Begins is a quiet experience that surely leaves you eager to know more about the fantastical world it's set in. Don't let the fact that it's built with cookie-cutter assets fool you though, this game packs more depth than it lets on. There isn't much to write about since this prologue section was exceedingly short - that's just a pet peeve of mine that doesn't detract from the overall quality of the product at all - and the story definitely has a lot of unexplained elements that might be covered in later entries in the series, but at this point in time I frankly feel that while it's rough around the edges, it's definitely something that some would enjoy. If you're curious to know what this game is all about, don't overthink it and jump right in.

sheeeeeeeeeeesh
 
Wumao
32 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 novembre 2021
The prequel to Nephise, this game feels slightly more polished. There are technically two puzzles in this game, with the first one being a much, much easier version of the one found in the original Nephise, and the other hardly living up to being a puzzle, as we're told exactly what to do.

That said, there are also two sets of collectibles this time: Instead of orbs, you have mushrooms and skulls. Why you can just walk into the mushrooms to pick them up, but you have to click on the skulls, I've no idea. Feels weird.

Otherwise, several themes from Nephise reappear, which is interesting(empty house, giant canine guardian, otherworldly creature at the end, start in forest and end in cave). Got to say, I'm intrigued by where this is going in the sequel, Nephise: Ascension.

Anyway, worth playing through. Took me 30 minutes to 100%.
 
Guyra
762 produits enregistrÃ©s
0

Well, there is polished game-jam level game.
Which means that it is short and simple.
I should mention that this one looks good, but no fun playing through.
The main location - forest - is almost dead, other parts are not disclosed at all.
 
AlexY
325 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juin 2021
Pretty much same as the self-titled first game: this is first, chronologically, but Nephise was made first. Mind, shrooms are a bit more difficult to see, especially from a distance, and the plot not quite so silly, but as a casual fetch quest slash forest wander, Much worse ways to spend an hour or so. (Okay, it's less if you know exactly what you're doing and have a good idea shrooms are or are following a guide. I was not. And I lolly-gagged considerably.)

Anyway, nice music and walking environment. Only real downside is, I think, a result of the game engine. In the first game this was not so much a problem: background textures shift constantly as you approach, which gives the appearance of melting and was kind of neat. It's just plain stupid and irritating when rock formations change appearance: uncool and very unreal, parden the pun.

One the bright side, no stupid VR-activation nonsense this time out, so the "morphing issue" is my only gripe, but it IS a serious one, and I'll leave it at that.
 
blastvortx

Es erzÃ¤hlt die Vorgeschichte von Nephise (wer auch immer das ist ^^) und was
passiert ist, bevor sie zur Sammlerin des Lichtes geworden ist.

Wie einige schon geschrieben haben, fÃ¼hlt es sich ein bisschen nach walking simulator
an, mit Pilze sammeln, 4 SchÃ¤del und diverse Interaktionen die auch mit Steamerfolgen
verbunden sind.

Man braucht ca. eine Stunde (vielleicht auch weniger) um "durch zu spielen",
ich hatte noch nach einer MÃ¶glichkeit gesucht in die oberen Etagen des
Hauses zu gelangen, jedoch erfolglos.

Im groÃŸen und ganzen niedlich gemacht, jedoch verpasst man nichts, denk ich.
Ich denke wenn man die anderen Teile gespielt hat, macht dieses hier mehr Sinn,
jedoch versteh ich die Aufspaltung nicht ganz.

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Preety much a walking simulator,kind of boring and short,acts like a demo lmao.While I may have enjoyed staring at and admiring the giant fox,listening to the soundtrack was a blast.About the graphics,well I say it looks decent.

Other then that,I would just say that if you want an easy source of achievements,well here it is.
You dont even need to spend another 10 minutes,to 100% this game.

About the price... well I wouldnt pay a single $ for this (and I was lucky enough to get this for free lel) I would be better off getting Nephise Collection (I gues) if I was going to spend anything on this.Well thats the way I see it.

Amenty
374 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 dÃ©cembre 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Simples e divertido. Bom para passar o tempo - Ã“timo para fazer insignia (5 cartas)

O objetivo do jogo Ã© simples, achar todos os objetos para adentrar na caverna. Primeiramente achei que o objetivo era somente pegar os cogumelos, mas a partir do momento em que vi uma Raposa guardando a entrada de uma caverna, notei que o principal do jogo era outro.

Terminei o jogo em 20 minutos, ao menos sem pegar todos os cogumelos, o que foi burrice da minha parte, que tive que reiniciar o jogo e pegar todos os cogumelos novamente para pegar a conquista. O jogo tem uma trilha sonora bem agradÃ¡vel, acho que casou bem com a temÃ¡tica do jogo, de ficar perambulando pelo bosque.

Por fim, acho que o ponto alto do jogo Ã© a paisagem. NÃ£o sou especialista em grÃ¡ficos nem nada, mas em geral a parte visual me agradou bastante. Ã‰ bom para render algumas capturas de tela.

Meus contras sÃ£o: O personagem anda muito devagar e jogo mal otimizado

Notas:
Trilha Sonora - 8/10
HistÃ³ria - 6/10
Visual - 8/10
DiversÃ£o - 7/10
Geral - 7/10

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Iâ€™ve contemplated buying some of TonguÃ§ Bodurâ€™s games before but I wasnâ€™t sure if I would enjoy them. So when this was being given away free of course I picked it up.

This game is very short and simple. All there is to the game is to wandering about the forest collecting a few things. The game could really do with a map as a lot of the forest looks very similar. The story is very superficial and it looks like they were going for enigmatic but ended up with just not making much sense.

So why am I giving this a thumbs up. The game has a curious charm to it. The forest looks very nice. The music and voice acting fit perfectly and create an enjoyable, relaxing experience. Itâ€™s noting earth shattering but I can seem myself buying some more of this series in the future.
 
Bob

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 novembre 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Disclaimer : I think this game was free at some point and that's when I got it.

Pro :
- Nice visuals and good ambient music
- Fitting and soothing narrator voice.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ :
- Seems like a tech demo as the entire game can be completed in about 15 minutes
- Very wonky movement of the keeper

All in all if you want to relax a little and/or calm down this is a ~ 20min walking simulator but seems rather like a demo / level 1 for a bigger game.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 novembre 2020
Expectations weren't high, as I only paid 1â‚¬ for this "game". Yet I was disappointed. I have not played any previous games by the dev, so it could just be my fault for not understanding the story.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥
- It was very short, took me 20 minutes but I could've done it in 10 easily.
- Some things just didn't make any sense, i.e why put a three story house in the middle of a forest, mention there was no staircase to upper floors, and just leave it at that. Also, having a compass (?) that didn't have any indication which way was north made it useless.
- Graphics weren't all that great as saturation was way too high

Pros
- Music was relaxing and some of the ambient noises. Although they were looping.
- The few lines, voice acting wasn't bad.

I can't really recommend this "game". The achievements were easy to get, so if you want 5 achievements and a Perfect game, there's that.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 novembre 2020
Great, short game!

I was hesitant at first due to my bad sense of orientation, but in hindsight, I think that was completely fine, since I found all the hidden "things" while wandering about.
Now there are a few achievements that can be missed, but it shouldn't be a problem to just start again, since the game is short.

If you are yearning for a relaxing stroll on the forest in these lock-down times, give it a shot in this game!

The game looks nice, that's all I can really say. There's not really any gameplay other than walking or clicking on something. There's only one area and it's the forest, it's a little big unfortunately because your walk speed is painfully slow. The game takes around 30 minutes, it took me an hour because there's collectible mushrooms that don't do anything. Even for it's low price, I've seen games that cost less offer more.

61
RecommandÃ©
5.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 octobre 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Thx for Free +1 !
The gameplay is centered around exploration, with players taking on the role of a young girl who wanders through a variety of environments, including forests, caves, and mountains. Along the way, we must solve puzzles and interact with the environment to progress through the game.

The game's sound design is also excellent, with a calming soundtrack that complements the game's visuals and helps to create a relaxing atmosphere. The use of ambient sounds, such as the chirping of birds and the rustling of leaves, further enhances the sense of immersion in the game's world.
 
Mutualrein
15,204 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
5.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 septembre 2020
Not recommended, but only slightly.

This is one of those games that can be so much more. The graphics, audio, narrator, atmosphere and overall presentation are very well done. This alone is enough to sell the game for many. What detracts from the experience for me was the slow character movement (no run) and lack of game play. You are on a hunt for mushrooms and animal skulls in the rocky forest which should take about 15 minutes. After you locate all of these items, you are pretty much done with the game, with the exception of some additional story elements. It's really cheap, so that might be enough to give it a go, but only if you really enjoy atmospheric walking sims.
 
JKillz

RecommandÃ©
2.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 aout 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

I grab Nephise Begins when it was on a free event a while ago.
Nephise Begins, seems to be a presentation of Nephise and allow us to play for about half an hour this intriguing puzzle game.
The game is a calm and relaxing mix of walking simulator with puzzle game. Very well crafted and graphically beautiful, with a relaxing soundtrack that I enjoy so much that I left playing for a lot more than I took to finish the game.

Overall a very nice addition to my Steam collect, especially being free. But as a paid game, even for a bargain price that it is I found it a bit expensive on a ratio price played time.
 
Night Geisha

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Not bad, but it still feels like a prove of concept because its still only 35 minutes to 100% the game. The main improvement over Nephise is that the map is bigger and more explorable. Seeing as it still only takes 35 minutes to complete the price is still too steep, I only recommend this on a good sale.

âœª éº»å­— Txm1 s2
236 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 aout 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Nephise Begins is a short experience where you play as, well... Nephise.
You are on your own from the beginning till the end with no maps, no directions and no nothing, this is the most frustrating part of the game. You only have a narrator who sometimes points out some details but it doesn't help in the grand scale of the idea. At one point they said to go to west but I found out there is no direction on the hud at all, usually you have north as a base guide but there was no way to find out which way goes where so i just guessed my way and found the necessary objects to proceed.

The Graphics are nice at first glance but have strange shadow glitches on rocks and overall ambiance slowly falls flat.
You have no way to move faster, having no map, guide and direction makes it frustrating and kills the exploration part. I love the exploration aspect in video games but it feels forced here, there are games like firewatch that let you use your walkie-talkie to add awesome conversations while you are exploring the terrain but here there is no such distraction except some soundtracks.

Overall this game is a good short experience if you don't mind the flaws. I will rate it 6/10.
 
PrimaSoul

Sammel rote Pilze und TierschÃ¤del

Ja, mehr gibt es eigentlich nicht. Nach 10 roten Pilzen und einem kleinen RÃ¤tzel, in dem man die SchÃ¤del auf Urnen absetzen und die Urnen drehen muss, ist das Spiel auch schon durch. Die Vorgeschichte zu Nephise ist mehr als nur wage, die Stimme der ErzÃ¤hlerin und die Musik genau die gleiche, wie in Nephise und immer noch beruhigend. Wer noch nie einen Walking Simulator versucht hat, oder mit der Ego-Perspektive Probleme hat, kÃ¶nnte hier eindeutig an seine Grenzen stoÃŸen, da es mehr als nur ruckelt.

+ nette AtmosphÃ¤re
+ nette Musik (wie in Nephise)
+ 5 Errungenschaften
+ 3 Sammelkarten

/ Grafik ok aber nicht bewegend
/ sehr ruckelnd

- reines Lauf und Such Game
- Spielzeit: knappe Stunde (Zwei, wenn ihr den letzten Pilz und SchÃ¤del, wie ich, nicht findet)

nicht wirklich zu empfehlen
Es ist zwar die "Vorgeschichte" und die Grafik ist schÃ¶ner, als im Nephise, jedoch sorgt dies auch fÃ¼r Performance-Problemen. FÃ¼r jene, die noch nie einen Walking Simulator probiert haben, ist es nicht zu empfehlen, da hier die 2â‚¬ doch recht weh tun. Ich selbst habe es der VollstÃ¤ndigkeit halber im Sale erworben und lege es nun zu den erledigten Games ab, wohl wissend, dass ich es wahrscheinlich nicht nochmal spielen werde. Have fun!

1.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 mai 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Pretty chill walking simulator. It's pretty easy to get lost and not know where you're supposed to go though. If there's one thing I would recommend for the devs to do, it's adding the mushrooms to the radar like they did for the skulls. And maybe increase the radar's detection range.

Also warning; try not to get stuck in between a tree and a cliff because there are no saves and you will have to start over. That was pretty frustrating.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Short and interesting game to kill time. But still there are a few things that should be mentioned. Firstly, its settings for graphics is a bit clunky. And even with low graphics it still freezes a little with a PC that can handle ultra graphics in other games, might be due to bad coding or something. Secondly, for its price game is too short. I am not against simple and short games, but at the very least before dividing a game into bunch of story collection, you should think will someone pay this much for every episode? Probably, no.

0
Non recommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

It's really bad and really short. (15 min if you don't get stuck in the ground.)
Assets are bought (not made by the author) and they are not even placed properly on the small map. Some trees are hovering, some are stuck in the ground. Giant Fox just walks on one spot with low fps instead of flying. You can get stuck near almost every little bump. AND game does not have a save feature, so if you are stuck - it's time to restart the whole game.
Animations are non-existent.
Game-play is non-existent. Collect a few things and that's it.
Sounds are like assets just some cheap generic stock sounds.
The fact that it's normally costs any money is almost a crime.

To be honest with ya, I wouldn't recommend spending a dollar on this game.
It's negatives heavily overweight the positive side.

Negative sides:
- Almost zero plot
- Walking simulator - just to find mushrooms and skulls
- The world is somewhat hardly walkable sometimes
- Basic animation, not sure if the giant flying fox with template idle animation is supposed to be a joke.
- There is no challenging puzzle as mentioned

Positive sides:
- Decent music, It's quite calming

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 avril 2020
This game isn't worth the $2 it's asking for.
1) No save
2) I'm lost on where to go, what to do.
3) Unreal Engine.
4) Watch someone else play it so you can skip through the video to learn what this game has to offer - it's hardly any.
5) "Time before Nephise was an orb collector", hah, what a joke. No story at all.
 
ma.tt
276 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Horrrible game - wouldn't even recommend it for free.
It's so disjointed and inconsistent that it barely manages to do anything at all.

- First off, the game is horribly optimized. At low settings (or as low as it could get - some of the buttons in the settings menu are bugged), my pc got steaming hot and loud like never before.
- Secondly, the entire game takes place in a giant forest map, and you have to scour it for 4 animal skulls. Who thinks this is fun gameplay? If the game is about story, then for the love of god, remove the requirement that i have to waste 30 minutes looking for skulls so i can instead be immersed in the story. You're going to lose 90% of people in the first 10 minutes, because it's not really that fun to walk around a giant unity-store-asset hell with so much bloom that it makes your eyes hurt without anything to do.
- Thirdly, the riddle with the skulls was nonsensical and aggrevating. "nine to the fox" ? what? In relation to where?
- Fourthly, the story is absolutely atrociously told. I still have no idea what happened, who i'm playing as, who the harpy is, what the orbs are, what the house in the woods was, what the animal skulls was about, what the giant fox was about, what the rotating statue was about, and why there is a mushroom counter when it's not necessary to collect them at all.
- Fifthly, What's even the point of a compass when it only works when you're within 10 feet of the thing your looking for anyways? 99% of the time the compass is going to be empty, and it doesn't even show you where north is, so how are you supposed to know where the skulls are from the information that "2 skulls are in the east and 2 are in the west"? It doesn't make any sense!

anyways that's all i can bare to comment. It's a bad game, and i do not understand how anyone can enjoy this, when they could just download a forest in the unity store, play some bird chirping in the background, and walk around aimlessly for a couple of hours.
 
Kebabs

Ğ˜Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğµ, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€ÑƒÑ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ¸ÑÑĞ»ĞµĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ.
Ğ¯ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°Ñ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ´Ğ¸, Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ»Ğ¾ÑĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğº Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾ÑˆÑƒÑÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ° Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ‚ÑĞ³Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµÑ.
Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ÑĞ´ĞºÑƒ:
1.Ğ“Ñ€Ğ°Ñ„Ğ¸ĞºĞ°. Ğ•Ñ‘ ÑĞ¿Ğ°ÑĞ°ĞµÑ‚ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒĞºĞ¾ ÑĞ²ĞµÑ‚, Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ³Ğ»Ğ°Ğ· Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€ĞµĞ¶ĞµÑ‚, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ¸ Ğ²Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ³Ğ° Ğ½Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ĞµÑ‚.

Ğ­Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ†ĞµĞ¿ÑŒ Ğ±ĞµÑÑĞ²ÑĞ·Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ… ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚Ğ¸Ğ¹, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ´Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑÑ Ğ¾Ñ‚ ÑĞ¸Ğ»Ñ‹ 2 Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½ÑƒÑ‚Ñ‹, Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´ÑŒĞ±Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ»ĞµÑÑƒ.
3.ĞšĞ°Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°. ĞŸÑ€Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ Ğ¸ Ğ¸ÑĞºĞ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ñ‹, Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ»Ğ°Ğ±Ğ»ÑĞµÑ‚.

Overall meh. The scenery was really nice, but there wasn't really any point to the game, even for a walking simulator. I don't regret playing it given that I got it for free, but I'm not going to bother buying the other games in the series.

- Really nice relaxing scenery
- Background music was good for the most part

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- No real story, which was it's biggest weakness IMO

Verdict: 6/10

Nazaretov Play
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 avril 2020
The only thing worse than a walking simulator is an open-world walking simulator that somehow manages to continuously handhold player through narrative portion AND give absolutely no navigational clue for their goals, turning it into the worst kind of a Skyrim mushroom picking simulator with a snail for a protagonist.

P.S. Trying to deliver a story, with a straight face, through narrator's short outbursts of exposition each time character triggers another script simply DOES NOT work in 2017 - that gimmick has been laughed off the stage by Stanley Parable, 2004's The Bard's Tale and alike.

P.P.S. Also, no save points.
No idea why game even bothers to boot you back into main menu first instead of straight to desktop, when you try to quit.
 
matrixdll
2,402 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
1.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 avril 2020
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

A great indie walking simulator in a beautiful looking forest.

It was a great and chilling experience. Its very short sadly, about 1 hour of game time, or maximum 2 even for the most casual ones. Have some hilariously cheap execution like, the flying out fox, then suddenly dissapear mid way and also the one touch harpy., but its still a great experience. Also a bit too red for me, thats maybe because I played on 1.4 brightness, but the sunlight was so realistic, while I was playing it, I constantly sneezed, what was fun. Also its kind of a hidden gem, sad to see nobody found it earlier, but happy to see it grown after the free to claim. Also funny to watch the "+39223.01%" player gain in the steam charts. Its really cheap, so absolutely worth the money, and I can just do recommend you to try this one out. Cute and Chill at the same time, I loved it!

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 30 mars 2020
My "recommend" is actually a mixed review. I've played a few of Bodur's walking sims, and this is the most likeable and enjoyable, although the plot is odd. I actually spent a lot of time and several goes playing it as I enjoyed the environment so much. Music's great. The graphics aren't his best work but okay.

My only real complaint however, is that there are NO SAVE STATES in this game! In what day and age does a game not have the ability to save? The game even begins by saying so caveating the game is "also a little long". That is disappointing.

Non recommandÃ©
1.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 septembre 2019
Game starts off nicely, beautifully looking for the price plus interesting soundtrack.
Narration is pleasant. "Puzzles" relatively easy since they're not meant to be the main focus (walking simulator, NOT a puzzle game).

HOWEVER: music doesn't fully fit the setting in my opinion and the contact to the character ends abruptly. No connection is formed. In that sense it's good that the game takes no longer than 30mins.

Would only recommend to buy in a sale at most.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 avril 2018
Pleasant enough, great scenery, reminded me of Skyrim when I was walking the area around Riften. It would be helpful to make the skulls a little more prominent, perhaps lots of birds could be placed as they would have picked the flesh of the skulls. Did find them eventually but I was near to giving up and real life concerns were intruding. For the price and as a respite from playing dark souls 2 it was an interesting time although tramping of shoes was rather intrusive.

PROS> The graphics are good. the game play is good. the music is good. I finished the game with all achievements in 20 minutes. I let the game run longer for the cards.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥> the story didn't make much sense. the game is to short. the only thing to do is walk around. the game tells you what to do. you do get to spin a statue and some jugs. oh yeah. you get to open a door.

I'd make the game longer. Have more tasks that arn't as easy as just walking around and there they are. and, if harpies were real, I don't think you could kill one just by touching it. there should have been a spell book in the house. then you could go search for ingredients to make a potion to throw on the harpy. or at least look for a bow and arrow to shoot it with.

I recomend this game because it's easy and looks ok and it has no bugs that I encountered.

Nephise Begins is a very small game with great visuals and a short story. It also has simple tasks such as; solving an animal skull puzzle and collecting mushrooms. The achievements can be easily attained just by collecting all the mushrooms and finishing the game.

0.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 juin 2017
OK, so this Game is cute and short, but it has issues. Here's an overview

(+)
Music: Beautiful
Graphics: Beautiful, that a tad more variety would have been great. As in: flowers in more colors than blue ;)
Voice: Awesome! Very very pleasant story teller voice!
It's very short. That's kind of nice actually, but you need to know to avoid disappointments. I like the warning at the beginning of the game

(-)
Movement Speed: For me it was too fast, I saw another person state it's too slow. Hence: A minimum of 2 Speed options, better 3-5 would have been nicer (Extending the field of view helped, btw. It felt like I was moving slower, which was helping me to not feel nauseous!)
Storyline: Everything was fine till I got to the cave. Wait, what? In such a peaceful game I end up killing sth. And then it says the orbs were too powerful but she kept collecting them? (I've not played the main game yet, btw.). That was very confusing and a very sudden ending. Then there was that statue that seemed to have no effect whatsoever.

Thereâ€™s that nice tower with a little sth. inside. And it has a ladder, but you cannot go up there. Now that was frustrating *lol*. I wanted to look around XD

I found N's but couldn't interact with them and btw. None of the achievements were unlocked for me although I got almost all of them. (Maybe because STEAM was offline or cause I started the game from the 360 Controller Emulator. I does work now, so it was just some bog). And here's another problem: Almost all. I didn't find one mushroom. I didn't expect the game to just end on me. Since there's no saving option (there always should be one, really) I couldn't return to get the last mushroom either. Now I'd have to start from 0. I would have enjoyed being able to return from the cave just for the view even! So that part could be done better in a future release. :)

My controller didn't work. I've tried to set up "TocaEdit Xbox 360 Controller Emulator". While it worked for other games I used so far, it didn't work for this one. Maybe I needed to pick special options, but again, I'm not a frequent gamer, so Iâ€™d need someone to post a short tutorial how to make it work particularly for this game. :) However, it was short, so I was fine using PC keys.


Overall: Nice. Maybe nicer if you know the background by playing the main game. If you're looking for your own parch of pretty forest with music and a little sun to drop into, then you can get this game :)
 
Miss K
